# Tentacles.name: # Macki
# Tentacles.description:
The creature has a number of tentacles equal to #.

  • It gains one Free Attack Action per tentacle.
  • Each tentacle’s attack does Rating Damage, which includes its Strength Bonus already.
  • If it causes Damage, it can also give its opponent an Entangled Condition, which will initiate a Grapple between the target and that tentacle.
    • If a tentacle is Grappling, use the tentacle’s Free Attack Action to resolve that Grapple, not the creature’s Action

Accurate Shot.name: Precyzyjny strzał
Accurate Shot.description: You are an exceptional shot and know where to shoot an enemy in order to inﬂict maximum damage. You deal your Accurate Shot level in extra Damage with all ranged weapons.

Acquiescence.name: Przyzwolenie
Acquiescence.description: Your magic pierces deep within your target, ﬂooding the soul with an acute awareness of their broken dreams. The target’s Initiative Characteristic drops to 10, if it was not already lower, as the mind turns inwards. On the target’s Turn, all movement is randomized as determined by the GM as the character bemoans life, lewdly telling all what should have been as hands are ﬂung in the air. Further, the target can only perform an Action if a Challenging (+0) Cool Test is first passed; if failed, the Target is far too busy bemoaning what could have been to do anything else

Acute Sense.name: Ostry zmysł
Acute Sense.description: One of your primary five senses is highly developed, allowing you to spot what others miss. You may take Perception Tests to detect normally imperceptible details with the associated sense, as dictated by the GM. This could include: seeing an eagle beyond everyone else's eyeshot, smelling an almost odorless poison, hearing the breath of an unmoving mouse within a wall, feeling a worn away letter in a carving, or tasting that two beers from the same brewer have been drawn from two different barrels.

Aethyric Armour.name: Zbroja Etyryczna
Aethyric Armour.description: You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Aethyric Armour (Beasts).name: Zbroja eteryczna (Bestie)
Aethyric Armour (Beasts).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Aethyric Armour (Daemonology).name: Zbroja Etyryczna (Daemonologia)
Aethyric Armour (Daemonology).description: You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Aethyric Armour (Death).name: Pancerz Etyryczny (Śmierć)
Aethyric Armour (Death).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Aethyric Armour (Fire).name: Zbroja Etyryczna (Ogień)
Aethyric Armour (Fire).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Aethyric Armour (Heavens).name: Zbroja Etyryczna (Niebiosa)
Aethyric Armour (Heavens).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Aethyric Armour (Hedgecraft).name: Zbroja eteryczna (żywopłoty)
Aethyric Armour (Hedgecraft).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Aethyric Armour (Life).name: Pancerz Eteryczny (Życie)
Aethyric Armour (Life).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Aethyric Armour (Light).name: Zbroja Etyryczna (Lekka)
Aethyric Armour (Light).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Aethyric Armour (Metal).name: Zbroja eteryczna (metalowa)
Aethyric Armour (Metal).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Aethyric Armour (Necromancy).name: Zbroja Etyryczna (Nekromancja)
Aethyric Armour (Necromancy).description: You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Aethyric Armour (Shadow).name: Zbroja Etyryczna (Cień)
Aethyric Armour (Shadow).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Aethyric Armour (Witchcraft).name: Zbroja eteryczna (czary)
Aethyric Armour (Witchcraft).description:
You gain +1 Armor Point to all Hit Locations as you wrap yourself in a protective swathe of magic.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Aethyric Arms.name: Ramiona eteryczne
Aethyric Arms.description: You create a melee weapon with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus. This may take any form, and so use any Melee Skill you may possess. The weapon counts as Magical.

Aethyric Arms (Beasts).name: Etyryczne Ramiona (Bestie)
Aethyric Arms (Beasts).description:

Aethyric Attunement.name: Dostrojenie eteryczne
Aethyric Attunement.description: Your experience, talent or training lets you more safely manipulate the Winds of Magic. You do not suffer a Miscast if you roll a double on a successful Channel Test.

Afraid.name: Przestraszony
Afraid.description:
The creature is afraid of the Target as if the Target has Fear (0). 

The Fear trait represents an extreme aversion to something. Creatures that cause Fear have a Fear Rating; this value reﬂects the SL you are required to pass on an Extended Cool Test to overcome your Fear. You may continue to Test at the end of every round until your SL equals or surpasses the creature’s Fear rating. Until you do this, you are subject to Fear.

 

When subject to Fear, you suffer –1 SL on all Tests to affect the source of your fear. You may not move closer to whatever is causing Fear without passing a Challenging (+0) Cool Test. If it comes closer to you, you must pass a Challenging (+0) Cool Test, or gain a Broken Condition.

Ale, Keg.name: Piwo, Keg
Ale, Keg.description: Capacity 3 gallons. Empty kegs can be refilled for 18d

Alley Cat.name: Ulicznik
Alley Cat.description: You are at home in shadowy backstreets. When using Stealth (Urban), you may reverse the dice of any failed Test if this will score a Success.

Amber Talons.name: Bursztynowe szpony
Amber Talons.description:
Your nails grow into wickedly sharp talons of crystal amber. Unarmed attacks made using Melee (Brawling) count as magical, have a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, and inﬂict +1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition whenever they cause a loss of Wounds.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Ambidextrous.name: Oburęczny
Ambidextrous.description: You can use your off-hand far better than most folk, either by training or innate talent. You only suffer a penalty of -10 to Tests relying solely on your secondary hand, not -20. If you have this Talent twice, you suffer no penalty at all.

Amphibious.name: Ziemnowodny
Amphibious.description: The creature is at home in water. It can add its Agility Bonus to the SL of all Swim Tests and move at full Movement through water.

Amputated Arm.name: Amputowane ramię
Amputated Arm.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}

Arm: You take a –20 penalty on all Tests that rely on the use of two hands and you cannot wield two-handed weapons. Should the lost hand be your primary hand, you take the customary –20 penalty to Melee Tests made with weapons using your secondary hand. For every 100 XP you spend, you can reduce this penalty by 5 as you relearn how to do everything with the other hand. If you lose both hands, it is probably time to master hook fighting

Amputated Ear.name: Amputowane ucho
Amputated Ear.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}

Ear: Losing an ear is painful, but you will soon learn to live without it. Should you have the bad luck to lose both your ears, permanently suffer a penalty of –20 to all hearing-based Perception Tests. Further, you suffer a penalty of –5 to all Fellowship Tests per ear lost when others can see your earless state

Amputated Eye.name: Amputowane oko
Amputated Eye.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}

Eye: For all losing an eye is horrendous, but you soon learn to compensate. Should you have the misfortune to lose both eyes, suffer a penalty of –30 to all Tests inﬂuenced by sight, such as Weapon Tests, Dodge Tests, Ride Tests, and similar. Further, you suffer a penalty of –5 to all Fellowship Tests per scarred socket others can see

Amputated Finger.name: Amputowany palec
Amputated Finger.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}

Finger: Further, you suffer a penalty of –5 to all Tests using the hand in question per finger lost. Once 4 or more fingers are lost on a hand, use the rules for a severed hand.

Amputated Foot.name: Amputowana stopa
Amputated Foot.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}

Foot: Reduce your Move by half permanently and suffer a –20 penalty to all Tests that rely on mobility, such as Dodge. Losing both feet makes it hard to walk. Perhaps you could hire a henchman to carry you?

Amputated Hand.name: Amputowana ręka
Amputated Hand.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgey}.

Hand:  You take a –20 penalty on all Tests that rely on the use of two hands and you cannot wield two-handed weapons; however, a shield can be strapped to the injured arm. Should the lost hand be your primary hand, you take the customary –20 penalty to Melee Tests made with weapons using your secondary hand. For every 100 XP you spend, you can reduce this penalty by 5 as you relearn how to do everything with the other hand. If you lose both hands, it is probably time to master hook fighting

Amputated Leg.name: Amputowana noga
Amputated Leg.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgey}.

Leg:  Reduce your Move by half permanently and suffer a –20 penalty to all Tests that rely on mobility, but cannot use the Dodge Skill. Losing both feet makes it hard to walk. Perhaps you could hire a henchman to carry you?

Amputated Nose.name: Amputowany nos
Amputated Nose.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgey}.

Nose:  A loss of a nose leaves one looking freakish in the extreme. Suffer a permanent loss of –20 to your Fellowship and suffer a penalty of –30 to all Tests involving the sense of smell.

Amputated Teeth.name: Amputowane zęby
Amputated Teeth.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgey}

Teeth:  Loss of teeth may be unsightly and can make eating difficult. For every two teeth you lose you also suffer a permanent loss of 1 from your Fellowship characteristic. Further, once more than half your teeth (Humans: 16; Elves: 18; Halﬂings and Dwarfs: 20) are lost, you find consuming solids significantly more difficult than your peers, doubling eating times, and making some foodstuffs nigh-on impossible to eat, which is largely a matter of roleplaying and narrative description of your actions.

Amputated Toe.name: Amputowany palec
Amputated Toe.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgey}.

Toes: Loss of toes has an adverse effect on your balance. For each toe lost, suffer a permanent loss of –1 to your Agility and Weapon Skill Characteristics.

Amputated Tongue.name: Amputowany język
Amputated Tongue.description:
Whenever you suffer a Critical Wound marked Amputation (Difficulty) you must pass an Endurance test of the corresponding difficulty or gain a @Condition[Prone] Condition. On a Failure (-2) or worse, you gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition; on an impressive Failure (-4 or worse), gain an @Condition[Unconscious] condition

All amputations require Surgery to heal properly, meaning 1 Wound cannot be healed until you visit a surgeon. See @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgey}.

Tongue: A loss of a tongue leaves you grunting and humming, or relying on make-shift sign language, for communication. You automatically fail all Language Tests involving speaking.

An Invitation.name: Zaproszenie
An Invitation.description: You spin one of Ranald’s riddles concerning portals, and whether they exist if closed. A door, window, or hatch you target has one method of securing it undone — a lock unlocks, a latch unlatches, a rope unties. For every +2 SL you may target another method of securing the door, window, or hatch.

Anchorite's Endurance.name: Wytrzymałość Anchoryty
Anchorite's Endurance.description: Your earnest prayers appeal to Shallya to grant the target the strength to endure. The target feels no pain, and suffers no penalties caused by Conditions.

Animal Affinity.name: Powinowactwo zwierząt
Animal Affinity.description: Wild animals feel comfortable in your presence, and often follow your lead. All creatures with the Bestial Trait not trained to be belligerent will automatically be calm in your presence unless they have a reason not to be, such as pain, an attack, being naturally hyper-aggressive, or having nearby young.

Animal Friend.name: Przyjaciel zwierząt
Animal Friend.description:
You make friends with a creature that is smaller than you and possesses the Bestial creature Trait. The animal trusts you completely and regards you as a friend.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Animal Instincts.name: Instynkt zwierzęcy
Animal Instincts.description: You intone chants describing Taal’s extraordinary senses, and calling upon him for aid. While the Miracle is in effect, you gain +1 @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9h82z72XGo9tfgQS]{Acute Sense (choose one)} Talent and, if you rest, you will automatically awaken should any threats come within Initiative yards.

Animosity.name: Animozja
Animosity.description:
You harbor an enmity for the Target, which will normally be a group of people or creatures, such as ‘Nordlanders’, ‘Beastmen’, or ‘Nobles’. You must attempt a Psychology Test whenever you encounter the group. If you pass, you may grumble and spit, but only suffer a penalty of –20 to all Fellowship Tests towards that group. Should you fail you are subject to Animosity.

 

At the end of every subsequent Round, you may attempt another Psychology test to bring the Animosity to an end. If you do not, the effects of Animosity naturally come to an end when all members of the specified group in your line of sight are utterly pacified or gone, or you gain the Stunned or Unconscious Condition, or you become subject to another Psychology.

 

When subject to Animosity, you must immediately attack the disagreeable creatures, either socially (insults, jibes, and similar) or physically (most commonly with fists), as appropriate. You also gain a bonus of +1 SL on any attempts to socially or mentally attack the group. Animosity is over-ridden by Fear and Terror.

Animosity (Target).name: Animozja (cel)
Animosity (Target).description:
You harbor an enmity for the Target, which will normally be a group of people or creatures, such as ‘Nordlanders’, ‘Beastmen’, or ‘Nobles’. You must attempt a Psychology Test whenever you encounter the group. If you pass, you may grumble and spit, but only suffer a penalty of –20 to all Fellowship Tests towards that group. Should you fail you are subject to Animosity.

At the end of every subsequent Round, you may attempt another Psychology test to bring the Animosity to an end. If you do not, the effects of Animosity naturally come to an end when all members of the specified group in your line of sight are utterly pacified or gone, or you gain the @Condition[Stunned] or @Condition[Unconscious] Condition, or you become subject to another Psychology.

When subject to Animosity,

  • You must immediately attack the disagreeable creatures, either socially (insults, jibes, and similar) or physically (most commonly with fists), as appropriate.
  • You also gain a bonus of +1 SL on any attempts to socially or mentally attack the group.

Animosity is over-ridden by @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Ib2YQYChktDFN93y]{Fear} and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.meMkLEwdJIDLxM0B]{Terror}.

Antitoxin Kit.name: Zestaw antytoksyny
Antitoxin Kit.description: Contains a small knife, herbs, and a jar of leeches. A successful Heal Test with an antitoxin kit removes all Poisoned Conditions. Treatment takes at least two Rounds.

Aqshy’s Aegis.name: Egida Aqshy’ego
Aqshy’s Aegis.description:
You wrap yourself in a fiery cloak of Aqshy, which channels ﬂame into the Aegis. You are completely immune to damage from non-magical fire, including the breath attacks of monsters, and ignore any @Condition[Ablaze] Conditions you receive. You receive the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Bvd2aZ0gQUXHfCTh]{Ward (9+)} Creature Trait against magical fire attacks including spells from the Lore of Fire.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Arboreal.name: Nadrzewny
Arboreal.description: The creature is at home in the forests. In the woodlands, it adds its Agility Bonus to the SL of all Climb and Stealth Tests.

Arcane Magic.name: Tajemna magia
Arcane Magic.description:
You either study one of the 8 Arcane Lores of Magic — Beasts, Death, Fire, Heavens, Metal, Shadow, Light, or Life — or practice a lesser known Lore, such as Hedgecraft or Necromancy. You may now memorize spells from your chosen Lore for the following cost in XP.

Number of Spells Currently Known

XP Cost for a new spell

Intelligence Bonus × 1 

100 XP

Intelligence Bonus × 2

200 XP

Intelligence Bonus × 3

300 XP

Intelligence Bonus × 4

400 XP

 ...and so on.

So, if your Intelligence Bonus is 4, it will cost you 100 XP for the first spell, and the next 4, then 200 XP for the next 4, and so on. Full rules for learning new spells are provided in @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.YBVrpUHEjohB1H4f]{Magic}. Under normal circumstances, you may not learn more than one Arcane Magic (Lore) Talent. Further, you may not learn the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.QyjWtSdnVMT04l5Y]{Bless} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.voV0C2ar1bKpcpnH]{Invoke} Talents when you have the Arcane Magic Talent. You can unlearn this Talent for 100 XP, but will immediately lose all of your spells if you do so.

Argumentative.name: Rzeczowy
Argumentative.description: You are used to arguing your points and winning. If you roll a successful Charm Test to debate with an opponent, you can choose to either use your rolled SL, or the number rolled on your units die. So, a successful roll of 24 could be used for +4 SL

Armour.name: Zbroja
Armour.description: The creature is protected by armor or thick hide. It has Rating Armor Points on all Hit Locations

Arrow Shield.name: Tarcza Strzałkowa
Arrow Shield.description: Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Arrow Shield (Beasts).name: Tarcza Strzałkowa (Potwory)
Arrow Shield (Beasts).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the Fear (1) Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Arrow Shield (Daemonology).name: Tarcza Strzał (Daemonologia)
Arrow Shield (Daemonology).description: Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Arrow Shield (Death).name: Tarcza Strzał (Śmierć)
Arrow Shield (Death).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Arrow Shield (Fire).name: Tarcza Strzałkowa (Ogień)
Arrow Shield (Fire).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Arrow Shield (Heavens).name: Tarcza Strzałek (Niebiosa)
Arrow Shield (Heavens).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Arrow Shield (Hedgecraft).name: Tarcza ze strzałami (żywopłoty)
Arrow Shield (Hedgecraft).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Arrow Shield (Life).name: Tarcza ze strzałkami (życie)
Arrow Shield (Life).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the Daemonic or Undead Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all Fatigued and Bleeding Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the Undead Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Arrow Shield (Light).name: Tarcza Strzałek (Światło)
Arrow Shield (Light).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: You may inﬂict one Blinded Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the Daemonic or Undead Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Arrow Shield (Metal).name: Tarcza ze strzałami (metalowa)
Arrow Shield (Metal).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Spells inﬂicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inﬂict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Arrow Shield (Necromancy).name: Tarcza Strzał (Nekromancja)
Arrow Shield (Necromancy).description: Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Arrow Shield (Shadow).name: Tarcza Strzały (Cień)
Arrow Shield (Shadow).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Arrow Shield (Witchcraft).name: Tarcza ze strzałami (czary)
Arrow Shield (Witchcraft).description:
Any missiles containing organic matter, such as arrows with wooden shafts, are automatically destroyed if they pass within the Area of Effect, causing no damage to their target. Missiles comprising only inorganic matter, such as throwing knives or pistol shots, are unaffected.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Arterial Damage.name: Uszkodzenie tętnic
Arterial Damage.description: Gain 4 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Until you receive Surgery, every time you receive Damage to the Body Hit Location, gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions.

Artistic.name: Artystyczny
Artistic.description: You have a natural talent for art, able to produce precise sketches with nothing but time and appropriate media. This ability has several in-game uses, ranging from creating Wanted Posters to sketching accurate journals, and has spot benefits as determined by the GM. Further to this, add Art (Any) to any Career you enter; if it is already in Career, you may instead purchase the Skill for 5 XP fewer per Advance.

As Verena is My Witness.name: Ponieważ Verena jest moim świadkiem
As Verena is My Witness.description: By calling Verena as your witness, the truth of your words shines out for all to see. For the duration of the Miracle, providing you speak only the truth, all listeners will believe you speak truly. This does not necessarily mean they will agree with your conclusions, of course

Attractive.name: Atrakcyjny
Attractive.description: Whether it’s your piercing eyes, your strong frame, or maybe the way you ﬂash your perfect teeth, you know how to make the best use of what the gods gave you. When you successfully use Charm to inﬂuence those attracted to you, you can choose to either use your rolled SL, or the number rolled on your units die. So, a successful roll of 38 could be used for +8 SL.

Backpack.name: Plecak
Backpack.description: Counts as ‘worn’ when strapped to your back.

Bad Cut.name: Złe cięcie
Bad Cut.description: Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] conditions as a deep wound opens up your shin. Pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain the @Condition[Prone] Condition.

Badly Cut Toe.name: Źle obcięty palec u nogi
Badly Cut Toe.description: Gain 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition. After the encounter, make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test. If you fail, lose 1 toe — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.ZhMADOqoo0y8Q9bx]{Amputation (Average)}.

Badly Jarred Arm.name: Źle zranione ramię
Badly Jarred Arm.description: Your arm is badly jarred in the attack. Drop whatever was held in that hand, which is useless for [[/r 1d10]] - Toughness Bonus Rounds (minimum 1). For this time, treat the hand as lost.

Badly Twisted Knee.name: Mocno skręcone kolano
Badly Twisted Knee.description: You badly twist your knee trying to avoid your opponent. Gain a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.3S4OYOZLauXctmev]{Torn Muscle (Major)} injury.

Balm to a Wounded Mind.name: Balsam na zraniony umysł
Balm to a Wounded Mind.description: You call on Shallya to calm the troubled mind of your targets. All Psychology traits are removed for the duration, and afterwards the targets enter deep and restful slumbers that last until next sunrise, assuming they are not disturbed. Unwilling targets may make a Challenging (+0) Cool Test to resist sleeping.

Bandage.name: Bandaż
Bandage.description: A successful Heal or Dexterity Test removes +1 extra Bleeding Status.

Banishment.name: Wygnanie
Banishment.description:
You send a cleansing halo of Hysh out from hands, affecting all creatures within the Area of Effect whose Toughness is lower than your Willpower. Targets with the Undead and Daemonic Creature Traits gain the Unstable Creature Trait. If they already have the Unstable Trait, they are reduced to 0 Wounds.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Barkskin.name: Barkskin
Barkskin.description:
You cause the target’s skin to become hard and rough like the bark of a tree. While affected by the spell, add +2 to the target’s Toughness Bonus, but suffer a penalty of –10 to Agility and Dexterity.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Battle Rage.name: Szał Bitewny
Battle Rage.description: You are better able to control your Frenzy in combat. You can end your Frenzy with a successful Cool Test at the end of the round.

Beacon of Righteous Virtue.name: Latarnia Prawych Cnót
Beacon of Righteous Virtue.description: As you bellow prayers in Sigmar’s name, you become infused with holy fire of righteousness. All allies with Line of Sight to you instantaneously remove all Broken Conditions, and gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.8pVzgPkgWpTJvfhG]{Fearless} Talent while the Miracle is in effect and they remain in your Line of Sight. Any Greenskins with Line of Sight to you are subject to @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear 1}.

Bearing.name: Łożysko
Bearing.description:
You sense the inﬂux of the Winds of Magic from their source. You know which direction North is.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Beast Form.name: Forma Bestii
Beast Form.description:
You infuse your very bones and ﬂesh with Ghur, warping your body into that of a creature. When cast, select a new form from any of the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.3ZynTGhFpgwv6l1n.JournalEntryPage.ahM2hOJnyXcSKrdS]{Beasts of the Reikland} section of the Bestiary. Gain all the standard Traits of the creature, except the Bestial Trait. Further, replace your S, T, Agi, and Dex with those of the creature, then recalculate your Wounds. For every + 2 SL, you may include 1 of the included Optional Creature Trait.

While in Beast Form, you look like a normal version of the creature, with amber and brown coloring. You may not speak, which means you cannot cast spells, or attempt to dispel. If you have lost any Wounds when the spell ends, you lose the same number of Wounds when you revert to your true form, to a minimum of 0 Wounds

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Beast Master.name: Mistrz Bestii
Beast Master.description:
Your breath steams and your eyes take on a shining amber sheen as Ghur suffuses you. Your gaze and words convince 1 creature possessing the Bestial trait that you are its pack master, and it will fight to the death to protect you. While subject to your mastery it will follow your instructions, instinctively understanding simple instructions. If the creature is released from the spell — through the duration running out, or the spell being dispelled — it will retain enough residual respect and fear not to attack you, unless compelled to. Your allies may not be so fortunate.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Beast Tongue.name: Język Bestii
Beast Tongue.description:
You can commune with all creatures possessing the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.AGcJl5rHjkyIQBPP]{Bestial} Trait. Ghur clogs your throat, and your language comes out as snarls, hisses, and roars as befits the beasts to whom you talk. While the creatures are not compelled to answer you, or do as you bid, most will be curious enough to hear you out. You gain +20 on all Charm Animal and Animal Training Tests While this spell is active, you may only speak with beasts — you may not speak any civilized tongues, and can only communicate with your party using gestures or Language (Battle). Note, this also means you cannot cast any spells, or dispel, while Beast Tongue is active.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Beat Blade.name: Pokonaj Blade'a
Beat Blade.description: You are trained to make sharp controlled blows to your opponent’s weapon, creating an opening for an attack or simply impeding an incoming attack. For your Action, you can choose to Beat Blade before rolling. Perform a Melee Test; if successful, your opponent loses –1 Advantage, and loses a further –1 per SL you score. This Test is not Opposed. This Talent is of no use if your opponent has no weapon, or has a larger Size than you.

Becalm.name: Bądź spokojny
Becalm.description: You steal the wind from the sails of a ship or boat. It is completely becalmed. Even in stormy weather an area of eerie calm and smooth waters surrounds the vessel while gales, lashing rains and towering crests surge and crash around it. This area of calm extends for Initiative yards from the vessel, and if the ship is propelled by some other method, such as oars, the area of calm travels with it.

Bedroll.name: Pościel
Bedroll.description: Endurance Tests rolled to resist Cold Exposure gain a bonus of +20 when resting.

Belligerent.name: Wojujący
Belligerent.description: The creature loves to win a fight. As long as it has more Advantage than its opponent, it is Immune to Psychology

Beneath Notice.name: Pod zawiadomieniem
Beneath Notice.description: The high and mighty pay no attention to your presence, knowing you are well beneath their notice. Assuming you are properly attired and not in an incongruous position, those of a higher Status Tier will normally ignore you unless your presence becomes inappropriate, which can make it very easy to listen into conversations you perhaps shouldn’t. Further, characters with a higher Status Tier than you gain no Advantage for striking or wounding you in combat, as there is nothing to be gained for defeating such a lowly cur.

Berserk Charge.name: Szarża Szału
Berserk Charge.description: You hurl yourself at your enemies with reckless abandon, using the force of your charge to add weight to your strikes. When you Charge, you gain +1 Damage to all Melee attacks per level in this Talent.

Bestial.name: Bestialski
Bestial.description: The creature has no rational thought or language. It shies away from fire and gains a @Condition[Broken] Condition if struck by it. In defense, it only uses the Dodge Skill. If it loses more than half its Wounds, it will attempt to Flee unless protecting its young or cornered, or unless it has the Territorial Trait. If so, it enters Frenzy. Bestial creatures have no Fellowship characteristic

Big.name: Duży
Big.description: The creature is a large example of its species. It receives +10 Strength and Toughness, and –5 Agility.

Bite.name: Ugryzienie
Bite.description: On its turn, the creature may make a Free Attack by spending 1 Advantage. The Damage of the attack equals Rating and includes the creature’s Strength Bonus already

Bitter Catharsis.name: Gorzkie katharsis
Bitter Catharsis.description: In answer to your heartfelt prayers, Shallya draws a poison or disease into you and purges it, completely removing it from your target’s system. For every +2 SL you may purge another disease or poison. For each poison removed or disease cured in this manner, you suffer Wounds equal to [[/r 1d10]] – your Fellowship Bonus, not modified for Toughness Bonus or Armor Points.

Black Eye.name: Czarne oko
Black Eye.description: A solid blow hits your eye, leaving tears and much pain. Gain 2 @Condition[Blinded] Conditions.

Black Lotus.name: Czarny Lotos
Black Lotus.description: This deadly plant grows in Southland jungles and is used for blade venom. Victims who suffer at least 1 Wound from a sap-coated blade immediately take 2 Poisoned Conditions. Resisted with a Difficult (–10) Endurance Test.

Blanket.name: Koc
Blanket.description: Endurance Tests rolled to resist Cold Exposure gain a bonus of +20 when resting.

Blast.name: Podmuch
Blast.description: You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Blast (Beasts).name: Wybuch (Bestie)
Blast (Beasts).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Blast (Daemonology).name: Wybuch (Daemonologia)
Blast (Daemonology).description: You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Blast (Death).name: Wybuch (śmierć)
Blast (Death).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Blast (Fire).name: Wybuch (ogień)
Blast (Fire).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Blast (Heavens).name: Wybuch (Niebiosa)
Blast (Heavens).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Blast (Hedgecraft).name: Wybuch (żywopłot)
Blast (Hedgecraft).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Blast (Life).name: Wybuch (życie)
Blast (Life).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Blast (Light).name: Wybuch (Światło)
Blast (Light).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Blast (Metal).name: Wybuch (metal)
Blast (Metal).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Blast (Necromancy).name: Wybuch (Nekromancja)
Blast (Necromancy).description: You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Blast (Shadow).name: Wybuch (Cień)
Blast (Shadow).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Blast (Witchcraft).name: Wybuch (czary)
Blast (Witchcraft).description:
You channel magic into an explosive blast. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +3 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Blather.name: Blather
Blather.description: Called ‘opening your mouth and letting your belly rumble’ in Nordland, or simply ‘bullshitting’ in Ostland, blathering involves talking rapidly and incessantly, or talking volubly and at-length, about inconsequential or nonsense matters, and is used to verbally confuse and confound a target. You use your Charm Skill to Blather. Attempt an Opposed Charm/Intelligence Test. Success gives your opponent a Stunned Condition. Further, for each level you have in Blather, your opponent gains another Stunned Condition. Targets Stunned by Blather may do nothing other than stare at you dumbfounded as they try to catch-up with or understand what you are saying. Once the last Stunned Condition comes to an end, the target finally gets a word in, and may not be best pleased with you — after all, you have been talking about nothing or nonsense for some time. Should you stop talking, your opponent immediately loses all Stunned Conditions caused by your Blather. Generally, you can only attempt to Blather at a character once per scene, or perhaps longer as determined by the GM, as the target soon wises up to your antics.

Blazing Sun.name: Palące słońce
Blazing Sun.description: You call on Myrmidia to scour the battlefield of dishonorable foes, and a blinding ﬂash of golden light bursts forth. All non-Myrmidians looking in your direction receive 1 @Condition[Blinded] Condition. For every +2 SL, they receive +1 @Condition[Blinded] Condition.

Bleeding hand.name: Krwawiąca ręka
Bleeding hand.description: Your hand is cut badly, making your grip slippery. Take 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition. While suffering from that Bleeding Condition, make an Average (+20) Dexterity Test before taking any Action that requires something being held in that hand; if you fail, the item slips from your grip.

Bless.name: Błogosławić
Bless.description: You are watched over by one of the Gods and can empower simple prayers. You can now deploy the Blessings of your deity as listed in @UUID[JournalEntry.NcH9OhleJFfaUdon]{Religion and Belief}. Under normal circumstances, you may only ever know one Divine Lore for the Bless Talent.

Blessed.name: Błogosławiony
Blessed.description: The creature is Blessed and can enact Blessings; the relevant deity is indicated in brackets.

Blessing of Breath.name: Błogosławieństwo Tchnienia
Blessing of Breath.description: Your target does not need to breathe and ignores rules for suffocation.

Blessing of Conscience.name: Błogosławieństwo sumienia
Blessing of Conscience.description: Your target must pass a Average (+20) Willpower Test to break any of the Strictures of your deity. If they fail, they are overcome with Shame and do not take the action.

Blessing of Fortune.name: Błogosławieństwo fortuny
Blessing of Fortune.description: Your target’s next failed test may be rerolled. The reroll must stand.

Blessing of Protection.name: Błogosławieństwo Ochrony
Blessing of Protection.description: Enemies must make an Average (+20) Willpower Test to attack your target as shame wells within for considering violence. If they fail, they must choose a different target, or a different Action

Blessing of Recuperation.name: Błogosławieństwo powrotu do zdrowia
Blessing of Recuperation.description: Your target may reduce the duration of 1 disease with which they are afflicted by 1 day. This prayer may only be attempted once per instance of a disease per person.

Blessing of Savagery.name: Błogosławieństwo dzikości
Blessing of Savagery.description: When your target next inﬂicts a Critical Wound, roll twice and choose the best result.

Blight.name: Zwarzyć
Blight.description:
You may target either a well, a field, or a domestic animal. If you successfully cast the spell, the target suffers from a blight:

  • A blighted well becomes instantly brackish and stagnant
  • Any crops currently planted in a Blighted field rot overnight
  • A blighted animal sickens. The afflicted beast no longer produces anything (cows produce no milk, hens produce no eggs, coats and hides grow mangy and unusable) and will die in 10–SL days

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inﬂict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell’s CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast.
