Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Blind Justice.name: Ślepa sprawiedliwość
Blind Justice.description: You articulate prayers concerning Verena’s acute perceptions, able pierce through to the truth of all things. You may make a Simple Challenging (+0) Perception Test to see through spells and Miracles of involving illusion or misdirection. You may also make a Average (+20) Intuition Test to tell whether a character speaking to you is lying. Note: this will only tell you if the character believes they speak the truth, it will not alert you if they are mistaken.

Blinding Light.name: Oślepiające światło
Blinding Light.description:
You emit a bright, blinding ﬂash of light from your hand or staff. Everyone looking at you, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent, receives +SL Blinded Conditions.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Blood Rot.name: Zgnilizna krwi
Blood Rot.description: Your very blood is diseased, and your heart now pumps sickness through your body. Leeching the rot is the accepted cure, but some doktors instead cut careful incisions near the neck to free the contaminated blood, demanding the patient ingest of vast quantities of healthy blood to replace what is lost. Whether the patient accepts such remedies or not, without treatment, Blood Rot is deadly, and will likely end in a visit from the Mourners’ Guild and the @UUID[JournalEntry.NcH9OhleJFfaUdon.JournalEntryPage.HfmrIexylrgxIz2x]{Cult of Morr}.

Bolt (Beasts).name: Bolt (Bestie)
Bolt (Beasts).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Bolt (Daemonology).name: Bolt (Daemonologia)
Bolt (Daemonology).description: You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Bolt (Death).name: Bolt (Śmierć)
Bolt (Death).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Bolt (Fire).name: Pocisk (Ogień)
Bolt (Fire).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Bolt (Heavens).name: Bolt (Niebiosa)
Bolt (Heavens).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Bolt (Hedgecraft).name: Śruba (żywopłot)
Bolt (Hedgecraft).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Bolt (Life).name: Śruba (życie)
Bolt (Life).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Bolt (Light).name: Śruba (lekka)
Bolt (Light).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Bolt (Metal).name: Śruba (metalowa)
Bolt (Metal).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Bolt (Necromancy).name: Bolt (Nekromancja)
Bolt (Necromancy).description: You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Bolt (Shadow).name: Śruba (Cień)
Bolt (Shadow).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Bolt (Witchcraft).name: Bolt (czary)
Bolt (Witchcraft).description:
You channel magic into a damaging bolt. Bolt is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Book, Apothecary.name: Książka, aptekarz
Book, Apothecary.description: Apothecary books are usually hand-written. A basic apothecary book contains ingredient descriptions and diagrammed instructions for brewing processes. Formulas for Digestive Tonics, Healing Draughts, and Vitality Draughts are usually included (see Herbs and Draughts). Advanced texts contain formulas for more exotic draughts.

Book, Art.name: Książka, sztuka
Book, Art.description: Plays, poems, and ballads or perhaps musical arrangements scribbled on loose parchment, Art books come in many forms. They also include treatises on perspective, form, and style, often written by famous painters or sculptors — such as Leonardo da Miragliano — for mass printing

Book, Cryptography.name: Książka Kryptografia
Book, Cryptography.description: Where individual ciphers and encryption keys can be written on a single page or two, Cryptography books are often hand-scribed codices dealing with mathematics, numerology, and polyalphabetic encryption.

Book, Engineer.name: Książka, inżynier
Book, Engineer.description: The majority of engineering books are press-printed. Engineering is an advanced science in the Empire, largely due to the Imperial Engineers’ School in Altdorf and the Dwarf Engineers’ Guild. Because of this, Engineering texts are often authored, co-authored, or edited by Dwarfs.

Book, Law.name: Książka, prawo
Book, Law.description: Laws vary considerably from one region to the next. Cities with printing presses compile legislation in bound volumes, whereas judges in smaller towns often rely on documents handwritten centuries ago. Law books used by travelling lawyers or judges often combine printed and written pages from different towns across the Empire, collated and bound together within the same cover

Book, Magic.name: Książka, magia
Book, Magic.description: Spell grimoires are usually scribed by wizards, and their covers are often secured with locks. Sometimes grimoires are even protected by magical alarms or wards. Carrying a spell grimoire is punishable as heresy unless the owning wizard is licensed by the Colleges of Magic.

Book, Medicine.name: Książka, medycyna
Book, Medicine.description: Medical texts can either be scribed or press-printed, depending on the authoring physician’s prestige. Illuminations are common, and usually include detailed autopsy drawings and procedural diagrams.

Book, Religion.name: Książka, religia
Book, Religion.description: Religions books come in all forms in the Empire, a realm renowned for its religious observances. There is an eager market for the most popular texts, most of which are cheaply produced by printing presses.

Bookish.name: Książkowy
Bookish.description: You are as at home in a library as a seaman at sea or a farmer a-farming. When using Research, you may reverse the dice of any failed Test if this will score a success.

Bounce.name: Odbić
Bounce.description: The creature can bounce high, perhaps with powerful limbs, magic, or stubby wings. When Charging or Running, it doubles its Movement Characteristic, and can ignore all intervening terrain and characters as it leap over them.

Break and Enter.name: Przerwij i wejdź
Break and Enter.description: You are an expert at quickly breaking down doors and forcing entry. You may add +1 Damage for each level in this Talent when determining damage against inanimate objects such as windows, chests, doors, and similar.

Breath.name: Oddech
Breath.description:
The creature’s breath is a powerful weapon. On its turn, for the cost of 2 Advantage, it can activate its Breath as a Free Attack. Choose 1 target it can see within 20+Toughness Bonus yards. All characters within Strength Bonus yards of that target are struck, as are all characters between the creature and the target. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets (the creature’s single roll opposed by each individual target). All targets that fail take Damage equal to the attack’s Rating. Further, if the Trait is marked with any of the following types in brackets, apply the associated rules.

• Cold: Targets gain a Stunned Condition for every full 5 Wounds suffered (minimum of 1).

• Corrosion: All Armor and Weapons carried by affected targets suffer 1 Damage.

• Fire: Any Wounds caused ignore Armor Points. Targets gain an Ablaze Condition.

• Electricity: Any Wounds caused ignore Armor Points. Targets gain a Stunned Condition.

• Poison: Any Wounds caused ignore Armor Points. Targets gain a Poisoned Condition.

• Smoke: The area fills with smoke, blocking Line of Sight for Toughness Bonus Rounds.

The creature is immune to its own Breath. This attack is Magical.

Breath (Beasts).name: Oddech (Bestie)
Breath (Beasts).description:
You immediately make a Breath attack, as if you had spent 2 Advantage to activate the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.uqGxFOEqeurwkAO3]{Breath} Creature Trait. Breath is a Magic Missile with a Damage equal to your Toughness Bonus. The GM decides which type of Breath attack best suits your Arcane Magic Talent.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Briber.name: Przekupstwo
Briber.description: You are an exceedingly skilled briber. The GM should reduce the base cost of any required bribe by 10% per level you have in Briber, to a minimum of 10% of the original amount.

Bridge.name: Most
Bridge.description: You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Bridge (Beasts).name: Most (Bestie)
Bridge (Beasts).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Bridge (Daemonology).name: Most (demonologia)
Bridge (Daemonology).description: You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Bridge (Death).name: Most (Śmierć)
Bridge (Death).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Bridge (Fire).name: Most (ogień)
Bridge (Fire).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Bridge (Heavens).name: Most (Niebiosa)
Bridge (Heavens).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Bridge (Hedgecraft).name: Most (żywopłoty)
Bridge (Hedgecraft).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Bridge (Life).name: Most (Życie)
Bridge (Life).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Bridge (Light).name: Most (lekki)
Bridge (Light).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Bridge (Metal).name: Most (metalowy)
Bridge (Metal).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Bridge (Necromancy).name: Most (Nekromancja)
Bridge (Necromancy).description: You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Bridge (Shadow).name: Most (Cień)
Bridge (Shadow).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Bridge (Witchcraft).name: Most (czary)
Bridge (Witchcraft).description:
You create a bridge of magical energy, with a maximum length and breadth of your Willpower Bonus in yards. For every +2 SL you may increase length or breadth by your Willpower Bonus in yards.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Broken Arm (Major).name: Złamane ramię (główne)
Broken Arm (Major).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#major]{Broken Bones}

A bone is badly broken, either resting at an odd angle or has splintered at the point of breakage. The Hit Location is effectively unusable until healing.

Arm: You are down to one limb as the other is too painful to use, and may require binding. You take a –20 penalty on all Tests that rely on the use of two hands and you cannot wield two-handed weapons; Should the lost hand be your primary hand, you take the customary –20 penalty to Melee Tests made with weapons using your secondary hand.

Broken Arm (Minor).name: Złamane ramię (drobne)
Broken Arm (Minor).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#minor]{Broken Bones}

A bone has been fractured, but still aligned. 

Arm: You are down to one limb as the other is too painful to use, and may require binding. You take a –20 penalty on all Tests that rely on the use of two hands and you cannot wield two-handed weapons; Should the lost hand be your primary hand, you take the customary –20 penalty to Melee Tests made with weapons using your secondary hand.

Broken Body (Major).name: Złamane ciało (główne)
Broken Body (Major).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#major]{Broken Bones}

A bone is badly broken, either resting at an odd angle or has splintered at the point of breakage. The Hit Location is effectively unusable until healing.

Body: Strength and mobility is severely limited: -30 to Strength and Agility Characteristic, half your Move.

Broken Body (Minor).name: Złamane ciało (drobne)
Broken Body (Minor).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#minor]{Broken Bones}

A bone has been fractured, but still aligned. 

Body: Strength and mobility is severely limited: -30 to Strength and Agility Characteristic, half your Move.

Broken Collar Bone.name: Złamany obojczyk
Broken Collar Bone.description: Gain the @Condition[Unconscious] Condition until you receive Medical Attention, and suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.EaqlLRQigwnsEAXX]{Broken Bone (Major)} injury.

Broken Head (Major).name: Złamana głowa (główna)
Broken Head (Major).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#major]{Broken Bones}

A bone is badly broken, either resting at an odd angle or has splintered at the point of breakage. The Hit Location is effectively unusable until healing.

Head: Down to a liquid diet and will suffer a penalty of -30 to all Language Tests.

Broken Head (Minor).name: Złamana głowa (drobna)
Broken Head (Minor).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#minor]{Broken Bones}

A bone has been fractured, but still aligned. 

Head: Down to a liquid diet and will suffer a penalty of -30 to all Language Tests.

Broken Jaw.name: Złamana szczęka
Broken Jaw.description: The crack is sickening as the blow hits you under the chin, breaking your jaw. Gain 3 @Condition[Stunned] Conditions. Make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain an @Condition[Unconscious] Condition. Suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.hCadFsTRvLN9faaY]{Broken Bone (Major)} injury.

Broken Knee.name: Złamane kolano
Broken Knee.description: The blow hacks into your kneecap, shattering it into several pieces. You gain 1 @Condition[Bleeding], 1 @Condition[Prone], and 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition, and a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.2iult41Jehz0F1O8]{Broken Bone (Major)} Injury as you fall to the ground, clutching your ruined leg.

Broken Leg (Major).name: Złamana noga (główna)
Broken Leg (Major).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#major]{Broken Bones}

A bone is badly broken, either resting at an odd angle or has splintered at the point of breakage. The Hit Location is effectively unusable until healing.

Leg: Reduce your Move by half permanently and suffer a –20 penalty to all Tests that rely on mobility, and you cannot use the Dodge skill at all.

Broken Leg (Minor).name: Złamana noga (drobne)
Broken Leg (Minor).description:
@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#minor]{Broken Bones}

A bone has been fractured, but still aligned. 

Leg: Reduce your Move by half permanently and suffer a –20 penalty to all Tests that rely on mobility, and you cannot use the Dodge skill at all.

Broken Nose.name: Złamany nos
Broken Nose.description: A solid blow to the centre of your face causing blood to pour. Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or also gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition. After this wound has healed, gain +1/-1 SL on social rolls, depending on context, unless @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery} is used to reset the nose.

Bruised Ribs.name: Posiniaczone żebra
Bruised Ribs.description: All Agility-based Tests suffer a -10 penalty for [[/r 1d10]] days.

Brutal Dismemberment.name: Brutalne rozczłonkowanie
Brutal Dismemberment.description: Your arm is severed, spraying arterial blood [[/r 1d10]] feet in a random direction (see @Table[scatter]{Scatter}), before the blow follows through to your chest.

Brute.name: Bydlę
Brute.description: The creature is heavy and brutish. It receives –1 Movement, –10 Agility, and +10 Strength and Toughness.

Bugman’s XXXXXX Ale, pint.name: Bugman’s XXXXXX Ale, kufel piwa
Bugman’s XXXXXX Ale, pint.description: Merchants travel across the Old World to purchase this potent Dwarfen ale from the famous brewery founded by Josef Bugman. Bugman’s Ale is distributed to most major cities. One mug of Bugman’s counts as 4 mugs of normal ale for intoxication purposes (see @UUID[JournalEntry.6zOdTLv3YeYeJ4hR.JournalEntryPage.38Ux3mEWYuQ4heIT]{Consume Alcohol}), and grants immunity to Fear Tests for 1d10 hours.

Camaraderie (Group).name: Koleżeństwo (grupa)
Camaraderie (Group).description:
Camaraderie reflects positive feelings towards a group of individuals.

  • You must come to their aid if the group is threatened physically or socially.
  • You gain a bonus of +1 SL to any tests to defend or support the group.

Example: Amhold had a difficult childhood, growing up on the streets without a family. Despite his gruff demeanour he has Camaraderie (Orphans).

Cardsharp.name: Szuler
Cardsharp.description: You are used to playing, and winning, at cards, although your methods may involve a little cheating. When you successfully use Gamble or Sleight of Hand when playing cards, you can choose to either use your rolled SL, or the number rolled on your units die. So, a successful roll of 28 could be used for +8 SL. If you play a real card game to represent what is happening in-game, you may receive an extra number of cards per deal equal to your level in Cardsharp, then discard down to the appropriate hand-size before each round of play.

Careful Step.name: Ostrożny krok
Careful Step.description:
The magic ﬂowing through your feet ensures any organic matter you tread upon remains undamaged: twigs do not break, grass springs back to its original position, and even delicate ﬂowers are unharmed. Those seeking to use the Track skill to pursue you through rural terrain suffer a –30 penalty to their Tests.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Careful Strike.name: Ostrożne uderzenie
Careful Strike.description: You are skilled at hitting your enemy exactly where you want to, either at range or in melee. You may modify your Hit Location result by up to +/–10 per time you have this Talent. So, if you had this Talent twice and hit location 34, the Right Arm, you could modify this down to 14, the Left Arm, or up to 54, the Body.

Caress of Laniph.name: Pieszczota Lanifa
Caress of Laniph.description:
As you reach out your hand, it appears withered, even skeletal, drawing Shyish from your target’s corpus. This counts as a Magic Missile with a Damage of +6 that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points. For every 2 Wounds inﬂicted, you may recover 1 Wound.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Carouser.name: Bachant
Carouser.description: You are a seasoned drinker and know how to party hard. You may reverse the dice of any failed Consume Alcohol Test if this will score a Success.

Cart.name: Wózek
Cart.description: One driver and one draft animal required.

Carved Shin.name: Rzeźbiony goleń
Carved Shin.description: The weapon drives clean through your leg by the knee, slicing into bone and through tendons. Gain a @Condition[Stunned] and @Condition[Prone] Condition. Further, suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.3S4OYOZLauXctmev]{Torn Muscle (Major)} and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.7mCcI3q7hgWcmbBU]{Broken Bone (Minor)} injury.

Cat-tongued.name: Koci język
Cat-tongued.description: Like Ranald the Trickster God, you blend truth and lies as if there were no difference. When using Charm to lie, listeners do not get to oppose your Charm with their Intuition to detect if there is something fishy in what you say.

Cat's Eyes.name: Kocie oczy
Cat's Eyes.description: Does anything exist that cannot be seen? You riddle with Ranald, who sends a Divine Servant in the form of a cat as an answer. The cat looks like and has the capabilities of a normal cat, but cannot be harmed in any way. While the Miracle is in effect, you perceive everything the cat perceives — sight, sound, touch — and control its movement. Your senses are as sharp as a cat’s, but you do not have access to any of your own sense-enhancing Talents such as Night Vision. While the Miracle is in effect, you cannot perceive anything through your own senses, leaving you vulnerable.

Catfall.name: Upadek
Catfall.description: You are nimble and balanced like a cat, and are able to fall much greater distances unharmed than others might. Whenever you fall, you attempt an Athletics Test. If successful, reduce the distance fallen by 1 yard, +1 extra yard per +1 SL scored, for the purposes of calculating Damage.

Cauterise.name: Przyżegać
Cauterise.description:
Channeling Aqshy through your hands you lay them on an ally’s wounds. Immediately heal [[/r 1d10]] Wounds and remove all Bleeding Conditions. Further, the wounds will not become infected.

Targets without the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent, must pass a Challenging (+0) Cool Test or scream in agony.. If Failed by –6 or more SL, the target gains the Unconscious Condition and is permanently scarred, waking up [[/gmr 1d10]] hours later

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Cerulean Shield.name: Tarcza Cerulejska
Cerulean Shield.description:
You encase yourself in a crackling cage of sparking electricity and Azyr. For the spell’s duration, gain +SL Armour Points to all locations against melee attacks. If attacked by metal weapons — such as daggers, swords, and spears with metal tips — your attacker takes +Willpower Bonus Damage.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Chain Attack.name: Atak łańcuchowy
Chain Attack.description: You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Chain Attack (Beasts).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Bestie)
Chain Attack (Beasts).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Chain Attack (Daemonology).description: You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Chain Attack (Death).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Chain Attack (Fire).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Ogień)
Chain Attack (Fire).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Chain Attack (Heavens).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Niebiosa)
Chain Attack (Heavens).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Chain Attack (Hedgecraft).name: Atak łańcuchowy (żywopłoty)
Chain Attack (Hedgecraft).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Chain Attack (Life).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Życie)
Chain Attack (Life).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Chain Attack (Light).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Lekki)
Chain Attack (Light).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Chain Attack (Metal).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Metal)
Chain Attack (Metal).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Chain Attack (Witchcraft).name: Atak Łańcuchowy (Czarodzieje)
Chain Attack (Witchcraft).description:
You channel a twisting spur of rupturing magic into your target. This is a Magic Missile with a Damage of +4. If Chain Attack reduces a target to 0 Wounds, it leaps to another target within the spell’s initial range, and within Willpower Bonus yards of the previous target, inﬂicting the same Damage again. It may leap a maximum number of times equal to your Willpower Bonus. For every +2 SL achieved, it may chain to an additional target.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Champion.name: Mistrz
Champion.description: The creature is an extraordinarily skilled warrior. If it wins an Opposed Test when defending in melee combat, it can cause Damage just as if it was the attacker.

Chaos Magic.name: Magia Chaosu
Chaos Magic.description: By accident or design you have lost a portion of your soul to one of the Dark Gods, and can now practice the foul magics of Chaos. Your ruinous patron immediately grants you access to a single spell from the chosen Lore (most commonly the Nurgle, Slaanesh, or Tzeentch Lores) and you gain a Corruption point as the spell infiltrates your mind, never to be forgotten.

Chaotic Dreams.name: Chaotyczne sny
Chaotic Dreams.description: Gain the Fatigued Condition for the first two hours of every day

Chill Grasp.name: Chłodny uścisk
Chill Grasp.description: The creature’s touch chills its enemy’s souls. For the cost of 2 Advantage and its Action, it can attempt an Opposed Weapon Skill/Melee or Dodge Test. If it wins, its target loses 1d10 + SL Wounds with no modification for Toughness Bonus or Armor Points. This attack is Magical.

Choking Shadows.name: Dławiące cienie
Choking Shadows.description:
You wrap shadowy tendrils of Ulgu around your foes’ necks. Assuming they need to breathe, they gain +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition, cannot talk, and are subject to rules for @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#drowning-and-suffocation]{Suffocation}.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Clarity of Thought.name: Jasność myśli
Clarity of Thought.description:
You calm your target’s mind, allowing them to think clearly. All negative modifiers on their thinking processes — from Conditions, Mental Mutations, Psychologies, or any other source — are ignored while the spell is in effect.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Clean Break.name: Czysta przerwa
Clean Break.description: An audible crack resounds as the blow strikes your arm. Drop whatever was held in the associated hand and gain a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.4lj1ik958mbgAlaF]{Broken Bone (Minor)} injury. Pass a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test or gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition.

Cleft Hand.name: Rozszczepiona ręka
Cleft Hand.description: Your hand splays open from the blow. Lose 1 finger — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.SYjWiKDzMS6CtROJ]{Amputation (Difficult)}. Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] and 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition. For every succeeding Round in which you don't receive Medical Attention, you lose another finger as the wound tears; if you run out of fingers, you lose the hand — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.SYjWiKDzMS6CtROJ]{Amputation (Difficult)}.

Clever.name: Sprytny
Clever.description: The creature is particularly sharp-minded. It receives +20 Intelligence and +10 Initiative.

Coach.name: Trener
Coach.description: Two drivers and four horses are standard.

Coat.name: Płaszcz
Coat.description: Protects wearer against the elements and extreme cold; without a good coat or similar, you will receive penalties to resist Cold Exposure

Cold Blooded.name: Opanowany
Cold Blooded.description: The creature is cold-blooded and slow to react. It can reverse all failed Willpower Tests.

Combat Aware.name: Świadomość walki
Combat Aware.description: You are used to scanning the battlefield to make snap decisions informed by the shifting tides of war. You may take a Challenging (+0) Perception Test to ignore Surprise, which is modified by circumstance as normal.

Combat Master.name: Mistrz walki
Combat Master.description: Your accumulated years of combat experience allow you to keep lesser fighters at bay. For each level in this Talent, you count as one more person for the purposes of determining if one side out numbers the other. This Talent only comes into play when you are out-numbered.

Combat Reflexes.name: Odruchy bojowe
Combat Reflexes.description: You react like a flash of lightning. Add 10 to your Initiative for each level in this Talent when determining Combat Initiative.

Comet of Casandora.name: Kometa Casandory
Comet of Casandora.description:
You channel all the Azyr you can muster and reach out to the skies, calling down a comet to wreak havoc amongst your foes. Select a target point within range. At the end of the next round, make an Average (+20) Perception Test. For every +SL you achieve, you may move your point of impact by Initiative Bonus yards. 

For every –SL, the GM will move the point of impact by Initiative Bonus yards in a random direction. Comet of Casandora then acts as a magical missile with Damage +12 that hits all targets in the Area of Effect, who also gain +1 @Condition[Ablaze] and the @Condition[Prone] Condition.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Commanding Presence.name: Dowodząca obecność
Commanding Presence.description: Your presence fills others with hushed awe and admiration. Such is your aura of authority, those with a lower Status may not resist your Leadership tests with their Willpower. Of course, enemies are still no more likely to respect or obey you, but the common folk rarely stand against you.

Concoct.name: Wymyślać
Concoct.description: You are skilled at making potions, philters, and draughts on the go. You may take one free Crafting Endeavour to use Trade (Apothecary) without need of a Workshop. Other Crafting Endeavors use the normal rules.

Concussive Blow.name: Wstrząsający cios
Concussive Blow.description: Your brain rattles in your skull as blood spurts from your nose and ears. Take 1 @Condition[Deafened], 2 @Condition[Bleeding] , and [[/r 1d10]] @Condition[Stunned] Conditions. Gain a @Condition[Fatigued] Condition that lasts for [[/r 1d10]] days. If you receive another Critical Wound to your head while suffering this Fatigued Condition, make an Average (+20) Endurance Test or also gain an @Condition[Unconscious] Condition.

Conserve.name: Chronić
Conserve.description:
You preserve up to a day’s worth of rations. During this time they will not rot, develop mold, or go stale, although they can still be harmed by external factors, such as getting wet or being burned or poisoned.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Constrictor.name: Zwieracz
Constrictor.description: The creature can squeeze and crush its prey. Any successful roll to hit gives the target an Entangled Condition. The creature may then enter a Grapple if it wishes.

Construct.name: Skonstruować
Construct.description:
The creature is a construct of magic, quite mindless, bound together with magical sinews. It has no Intelligence, Willpower, or Fellowship Characteristics, and need never Test them. If it has no wizard controlling it, or does not possess the Territorial Trait, it meanders mindlessly, following ﬂows of ambient magic.

 

For the purposes of calculating its Wounds, it uses its Strength Bonus whenever Willpower Bonus is required. All its attacks are Magical.

Contortionist.name: Człowiek guma
Contortionist.description: You can bend and manipulate your body in a myriad of seemingly unnatural ways. This allows you to squeeze through unlikely gaps and bend your body in crazy ways, giving benefits determined by the GM, possibly with a successful Agility test.

Coolheaded.name: Chłodny
Coolheaded.description: You gain a permanent +5 bonus to your starting Willpower Characteristic this does not count towards your Advances.

Coracle.name: Korakl
Coracle.description: Coracles are small, lightweight boats that accommodate one person and can be carried easily. They are made from leather or bark stretched over a wood frame, and rowed with a single oar.

Corrosive Blood.name: Żrąca krew
Corrosive Blood.description: You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Corrosive Blood (Beasts).name: Żrąca krew (Bestie)
Corrosive Blood (Beasts).description:
You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Corrosive Blood (Daemonology).name: Żrąca Krew (Daemonologia)
Corrosive Blood (Daemonology).description: You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Corrosive Blood (Death).name: Żrąca krew (śmierć)
Corrosive Blood (Death).description:
You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Corrosive Blood (Metal).description:
You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Corrosive Blood (Necromancy).name: Żrąca Krew (Nekromancja)
Corrosive Blood (Necromancy).description: You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Corrosive Blood (Shadow).name: Żrąca krew (Cień)
Corrosive Blood (Shadow).description:
You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Corrosive Blood (Witchcraft).name: Żrąca krew (czary)
Corrosive Blood (Witchcraft).description:
You infuse yourself with magic, lending your blood a fearsome potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M5QSWOYt2Rbv2yxW]{Corrosive Blood} Creature Trait

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Corruption.name: Korupcja
Corruption.description: The creature is tainted by Chaos, or perhaps suffused with Dark Magics. The Strength of the Corruption is marked in brackets (@Corruption[minor]{Minor}, @Corruption[moderate]{Moderate}, or @Corruption[major]{Major}).

Courtly Garb.name: Dworski Garb
Courtly Garb.description: Nobles’ garb features embellishments such as lace cuffs & collars, excessive high-quality fabric and pointed shoes. Servants also wear courtly garb to banquets and ceremonies, although their surcoats and corsets are less ostentatious than the nobles’ fashions and can therefore be purchased at half price.

Crack the Whip.name: Strzelić z bicza
Crack the Whip.description: You know how to get the most out of your animals. When an animal you control is Fleeing or Running, it gains +1 Movement if you are using a whip.

Cracked Ribs.name: Pęknięte żeberka
Cracked Ribs.description: The hit cracks one or more ribs. Gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition. Gain a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.QluSTTTq3viHJJUh]{Broken Bone (Minor)} injury.

Craftsman.name: Rzemieślnik
Craftsman.description: You have true creative talent. Add the associated Trade Skill to any Career you enter. If the Trade Skill is already in your Career, you may instead purchase the Skill for 5 XP fewer per Advance.

Creeping Menace.name: Pełzające zagrożenie
Creeping Menace.description:
You summon a swarm of creeping, slithering creatures to harass your foes. Each target affected is immediately engaged by a swarm of Giant Rats, Giant Spiders, or Snakes. Use the standard profiles for the relevant creature type, adding the Swarm Trait. For your Action you may make a Challenging (+0) Charm Animal Test to direct 1 or more swarms to attack a different target. When the spell ends, any remaining swarms disappear into the shadows.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inﬂict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell’s CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Criminal.name: Kryminalista
Criminal.description:
You are an active criminal making money from illegal sources, and you’re not always quiet about it. For the purposes of securing money, either when Earning during play or performing an Income Endeavour, refer to the following table:

 

Career Level

Bonus Money per time the Talent is taken

1

+2d10 brass pennies

2

+1d10 silver shillings

3 

+2d10 silver shillings

4

+1 gold crown

 

Because of your obvious criminal nature, others consider you lower Status than them unless they also have the Criminal Talent, where Status is compared as normal — perhaps you have gang tattoos, look shifty, or are just rough around the edges, it’s your choice. Because of this, local law enforcers are always suspicious of you and suspect your motivations, which only gets worse the more times you have this Talent, with the exact implications determined by the GM. Lawbreakers without the Criminal Talent earn significantly less coin but are not obviously the sort to be breaking the law, so maintain their Status. With GM consent, you may spend XP to remove levels of the Criminal Talent for the same XP it cost to buy.

Crown of Flame.name: Korona Płomienia
Crown of Flame.description:
You channel Aqshy into a majestic crown of inspiring fire about your brow. Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Trait and +1 @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.vCgEAetBMngR53aT]{War Leader} Talent while the spell is active.

For every +2 SL, you may increase your Fear value by +1, or take War Leader Talent again. Furthermore, gain a bonus of +10 on all attempts to Channel and Cast with Aqshy while the spell is in effect.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Crucible of Chamon.name: Tygiel Chamona
Crucible of Chamon.description:
You channel Chamon into a single non-magical, metallic object, such as a weapon or piece of armor. The item melts, dripping to the ﬂoor as molten metal, cooling almost immediately. If held, the item is dropped. If worn, the wearer takes a hit like a Magic Missile with Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus. While the object is destroyed, the metal retains its base value, and may be used by a smith as raw material.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Crushed Elbow.name: Zmiażdżony łokieć
Crushed Elbow.description: The blow crushes your elbow, splintering bone and cartilage. You immediately drop whatever was held in that hand and gain a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.rlDZZTj5PXjuRXa2]{Broken Bone (Major)} injury.

Crushed Foot.name: Zmiażdżona stopa
Crushed Foot.description: The blow crushes your foot. Make an Average (+20) Endurance Test; if you fail, gain the @Condition[Prone] condition and lose 1 toe, plus 1 additional toe for each SL below 0 — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.ZhMADOqoo0y8Q9bx]{Amputation (Average)}. Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. If you don't receive Surgery within [[/r 1d10]] days, you will lose the foot entirely.

Cunning.name: Podstępny
Cunning.description: The creature is exceptionally cunning. It receives +10 Fellowship, Intelligence, and Initiative.

Curse of Crippling Pain.name: Klątwa paraliżującego bólu
Curse of Crippling Pain.description:
Stabbing a crude representation of your target — a doll or puppet — you inﬂict crippling pain. When successfully cast, choose which hit location to stab:

  • Leg – Leg becomes useless, as if it was Amputated. If running, the target also gains the Prone Condition and takes falling Damage.
  • Arm – Arm becomes useless, as if it was Amputated. If target was holding anything in that hand, it is automatically dropped.
  • Body – Target doubles up in agony, gaining +1 Fatigued Condition, and must pass a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Prone Condition.
  • Head – Target gains the Stunned Condition, and must pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test or gain the Unconscious Condition for the Duration.

While the spell is in effect, for your Action you may make a Channeling Test, stabbing the doll again, to affect a different location.

Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell’s CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Curse of Ill-Fortune.name: Klątwa złego losu
Curse of Ill-Fortune.description:
The ingredient for this spell is something belonging to the target, either a personal possession or a strand of hair. For the duration, your target suffers bad luck. Laces snap, chairs break, and other minor narrative effects inconvenience them. The target suffers a penalty of –10 to all Tests, in addition to any other modifiers, and may not spend Fortune points.

Further, you may inﬂict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast.
