Cut Tendon.name: Przetnij ścięgno
Cut Tendon.description: A major tendon at the back of your leg is cut, causing you to scream out in pain as your leg collapses. Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding], 2 @Condition[Stunned], and 1 @Condition[Prone] Condition and look on in horror as your leg never works again — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.k00PimCWkff11IA0]{Amputation (Very Hard)}.

Daemonbane.name: Demonbane
Daemonbane.description:
You summon a blast of Hysh that passes through the border between the Realm of Chaos and the material world. The Casting Test is Opposed by the target making a Willpower Test. If you win, you obliterate a target with the Daemonic Creature Trait with a blinding white light, sending it back whence it came. If the spell successfully banishes a Daemon, everyone looking at your target, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent, receives +SL Blinded Conditions.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Daemonic.name: Demoniczny
Daemonic.description:
The creature’s essence is raw magic, and unholy ichor pumps through what passes for its veins. Daemonic creatures do not require the normal prerequisites for life: food, water, air…

All its attacks are Magical. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls the Target number or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical. Should the creature be reduced to 0 Wounds, its soul returns to the Realms of Chaos immediately, removing it from play.

Damaged Artery.name: Uszkodzona tętnica
Damaged Artery.description:
Gain 4 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Until you receive @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}, every time you take Damage to this Arm Hit Location gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions.

The Active Effect for this item needs your input. Replace ARM_LOCATION_HERE with lArm or rArm

Dark Vision.name: Mroczna Wizja
Dark Vision.description: You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Dark Vision (Beasts).name: Mroczna Wizja (Bestie)
Dark Vision (Beasts).description:
You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Dark Vision (Daemonology).name: Mroczna Wizja (Daemonologia)
Dark Vision (Daemonology).description: You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Dark Vision (Death).name: Mroczna Wizja (Śmierć)
Dark Vision (Death).description:
You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Dark Vision (Fire).name: Mroczna Wizja (Ogień)
Dark Vision (Fire).description:
You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Dark Vision (Heavens).name: Mroczna Wizja (Niebiosa)
Dark Vision (Heavens).description:
You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Dark Vision (Hedgecraft).name: Mroczna wizja (żywopłoty)
Dark Vision (Hedgecraft).description:
You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Dark Vision (Life).name: Mroczna Wizja (Życie)
Dark Vision (Life).description:
You boost your Second Sight to assist your mundane senses. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} Creature Trait

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Davrich Lamp.name: Lampa Davricha
Davrich Lamp.description: A safety lamp emitting the light of a candle, first developed for Reikland’s mines by Master Engineer Davrich Stephansson. It ﬂares brightly in ‘firedamp’ (explosive gasses); after [[/r 1d10]] Rounds of exposure to the lamp the firedamp will explode. It is wise to withdraw before this happens.

Dazzle.name: Oślepiać
Dazzle.description:
The target gains 1 @Condition[Blinded] Condition, and gains 1 Blinded Condition at the start of each round for the duration of the spell.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Deadeye Shot.name: Strzał z martwego oka
Deadeye Shot.description: You always hit an opponent right between the eyes… or wherever else you intended to hit. Instead of reversing the dice to determine which Hit Location is struck with your ranged weapons, you may pick a location.

Dealmaker.name: Dealer
Dealmaker.description:
You are a skilled businessman who knows how to close a deal. When using the Haggle skill, you reduce or increase the price of the products by an extra 10%.

 

Note: The GM may put a lower limit on prices here to show a seller refusing to sell below cost.

Death Mask.name: Maska Śmierci
Death Mask.description: Morr works through you, piercing the Portal to make his presence known to your foes. Your visage takes on a cadaverous mien, and you gain @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear 1}

Decapitated.name: Ścięty
Decapitated.description: Your head is entirely severed from your neck and soars through the air, landing [[/r 1d10]] feet away in a random direction (see @Table[scatter]{Scatter}). Your body collapses, instantly dead.

Deep Cut.name: Głębokie cięcie
Deep Cut.description: Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions as your arm is mangled. Gain 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition and suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.GlShFJF2TpsNh1FX]{Torn Muscle (Minor)} injury. Take a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain the @Condition[Unconscious] Condition.

Destroy Lesser Demon.name: Zniszcz Pomniejszego Demona
Destroy Lesser Demon.description:
Your spell disrupts the Dhar holding a target Daemon together, and draws it back to you. A target with the Daemonic Creature Trait and a lower Willpower than you loses Wounds equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus or Armor Points. In turn, you may increase one of your Characteristic by +10 for the duration as you siphon profane energies.

To gain the bonus, you must manually fill out the Characteristic Bonus effect.

Example

Attribute Key: system.characteristics.ws.modifier

Effect Value: 10

Destroy Undead.name: Zniszcz Nieumarłych
Destroy Undead.description: You call the power of Morr to smite all Undead. A black fire ripples forth from your body in a perfect circle for Fellowship Bonus yards. All potential targets with the Undead Creature Trait lose 1d10 Wounds, ignoring Toughness Bonus and AP. Any Undead destroyed by this Miracle can never be raised with Necromancy again under normal conditions. For every +2 SL, you may increase the area of effect by +Fellowship Bonus yards.

Detect Artefact.name: Wykryj artefakt
Detect Artefact.description: You are able to sense when magic lies within an artefact. You may attempt an Intuition Test for any magical artefact touched. If successful, you sense the item is magical; further, each SL also provides a specific special rule the item uses, if it has any. Normally, you may only attempt this Test once per artefact touched.

Detect Daemon.name: Wykryj Daemona
Detect Daemon.description: Your spell homes in on the daemonic inﬂuences in the surrounding area. You automatically know if there is a manifested Daemon within range, be it summoned, bound into an artefact, possessing another, or similar.

Devastated Eye.name: Zniszczone Oko
Devastated Eye.description: A strike to your eye completely bursts it, causing extraordinary pain. Gain 3 @Condition[Blinded], 2 @Condition[Bleeding], and 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition. Lose your eye — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.weczkAMPlTjX7lqU]{Amputation (Difficult)}.

Diceman.name: Diceman
Diceman.description: You are a dicing master, and all claims you cheat are clearly wrong. When you successfully use Gamble or Sleight of Hand when playing with dice, you can choose to either use your rolled SL, or the number rolled on your units die. So, a successful roll of 06 could be used for +6 SL. If you play any real-life dice games to represent in-game dice games, always roll extra dice equal to your Diceman level and choose the best results.

Die Hard.name: Być trudnym do wykorzenienia
Die Hard.description: No matter how hard the creature is hit, it gets back up. All Critical Wounds not resulting in death can be healed; just attach the requisite body parts to the correct places, perhaps with staples or large spikes to hold them in place, and it’s good to go. Even ‘death’ may be ‘healed’ if the appropriate parts, such as a lost head, are attached to the body. If death occurs and all parts are in place, it may attempt a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test requiring an SL of 6 at the start of every round for Toughness Bonus Rounds after death. If a Test is successful, the creature chokes back to life with 1 Wound.

Digestive Tonic.name: Tonik trawienny
Digestive Tonic.description: Provides +20 to recovery Tests from stomach ailments such as the Galloping Trots or The Bloody Flux

Dirty Fighting.name: Brudna walka
Dirty Fighting.description:
You have been taught all the dirty tricks of unarmed combat. You may choose to cause an extra +1 Damage for each level in Dirty Fighting with any successful Melee (Brawling) hit.

Note: using this Talent will be seen as cheating in any formal bout.

Disarm.name: Rozbrajać
Disarm.description: You are able to disarm an opponent with a careful ﬂick of the wrist or a well-aimed blow to the hand. For your Action, you may attempt an Opposed Melee/Melee test. If you win, your opponent loses a held weapon, which ﬂies 1d10 feet in a random direction (with further effects as determined by the GM). If you win by 2 SL, you can determine how far the weapon is ﬂung instead of rolling randomly; if you win by 4 SL, you can also choose the direction the weapon goes in; if you win by 6 SL or more, you can take your opponent’s weapon if you have a free hand, plucking it from the air with a ﬂourish. Tis Talent is of no use if your opponent has no weapon, or is a larger Size than you.

Disease.name: Choroba
Disease.description: The creature carries the disease listed. Others will have to Test as appropriate for Contraction

Disfiguring Blow.name: Oszpecający cios
Disfiguring Blow.description: The blow smashes your entire face, destroying your eye and nose in a cloud of blood. Gain 3 @Condition[Bleeding], 3 @Condition[Blinded] and 2 @Condition[Stunned] Conditions. Lose your @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.weczkAMPlTjX7lqU]{eye} and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.SpPRZZRHxly7uo2G]{nose} — Amputation (Hard).

Disguise Kit.name: Zestaw do przebrania
Disguise Kit.description: Contains enough props for four disguises (e.g. wigs and make-up) and also materials for changing your appearance used by those with the Entertain (Acting) Skill (e.g. wax, fake blood, and prosthetics).

Dislocated Knee.name: Zwichnięte kolano
Dislocated Knee.description: Your knee is wrenched out of its socket. Gain the @Condition[Prone] Condition. Pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test, or gain the @Condition[Stunned] Condition, which is not removed until you receive Medical Attention. After this initial Medical Attention, an Extended Average (+20) Heal Test needing 6 SL is required to reset the knee at which point you regain its use. Movement is halved, and Tests made using this leg suffer a -10 penalty for [[/r d10]] days.

Dislocated Shoulder.name: Zwichnięte ramię
Dislocated Shoulder.description: Your arm is wrenched out of its socket. Pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain the @Condition[Stunned] and @Condition[Prone] Condition. Drop whatever is held in that hand: the arm is useless and counts as lost (see @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MnMZv7ZXoRqoH9dS]{Amputated Part}). Gain 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition until you receive Medical Attention. After this initial Medical Attention, an Extended Average (+20) Heal Test needing 6 SL is required to reset the arm, at which point you regain its use. Tests made using this arm suffer a -10 penalty for [[/r 1d10]] days.

Distract.name: Rozpraszać
Distract.description: You are trained in simple movements to distract or startle your opponent, drawing eyes from your true intent. You may use your Move to perform a Distraction. This is resolved by an Opposed Athletics/Cool Test. If you win, your opponent can gain no Advantage until the end of the next Round.

Distracting.name: Rozpraszanie
Distracting.description: You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

Distracting (Beasts).name: Odwracanie uwagi (Bestie)
Distracting (Beasts).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Distracting (Daemonology).name: Rozpraszanie (Daemonologia)
Distracting (Daemonology).description: You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

Distracting (Death).name: Rozpraszanie (Śmierć)
Distracting (Death).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Distracting (Fire).name: Odwracanie uwagi (ogień)
Distracting (Fire).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Distracting (Heavens).name: Rozpraszanie (Niebiosa)
Distracting (Heavens).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Distracting (Hedgecraft).name: Rozpraszanie (żywopłoty)
Distracting (Hedgecraft).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Distracting (Life).name: Rozpraszanie (Życie)
Distracting (Life).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Distracting (Light).name: Rozpraszanie (Światło)
Distracting (Light).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Distracting (Metal).name: Rozpraszające (metalowe)
Distracting (Metal).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Distracting (Necromancy).name: Odwracanie uwagi (Nekromancja)
Distracting (Necromancy).description: You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

Distracting (Shadow).name: Rozpraszanie (Cień)
Distracting (Shadow).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

 

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Distracting (Witchcraft).name: Odwracanie uwagi (czary)
Distracting (Witchcraft).description:
You wreathe yourself in magic, which swirls around you, distracting your foes. While the spell is active, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait.

Dome.name: Kopuła
Dome.description:
You create a dome of magical energy overhead, blocking incoming attacks. Anyone within the Area of Effect gains the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Bvd2aZ0gQUXHfCTh]{Ward (6+)} Creature Trait against magical or ranged attacks originating outside the dome. Those within may attack out of the dome as normal, and the dome does not impede movement.

 

Perhaps because they are magical, wear a special talisman, or are just plain lucky, some blows just seem to miss. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls Rating or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical.

Dome (Beasts).name: Kopuła (Bestie)
Dome (Beasts).description:
You create a dome of magical energy overhead, blocking incoming attacks. Anyone within the Area of Effect gains the Ward (6+) Creature Trait against magical or ranged attacks originating outside the dome. Those within may attack out of the dome as normal, and the dome does not impede movement.

 

Perhaps because they are magical, wear a special talisman, or are just plain lucky, some blows just seem to miss. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls Rating or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Dome (Life).name: Kopuła (Życie)
Dome (Life).description:
You create a dome of magical energy overhead, blocking incoming attacks. Anyone within the Area of Effect gains the Ward (6+) Creature Trait against magical or ranged attacks originating outside the dome. Those within may attack out of the dome as normal, and the dome does not impede movement.

 

Perhaps because they are magical, wear a special talisman, or are just plain lucky, some blows just seem to miss. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls Rating or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical. 

 

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Dome (Light).name: Kopuła (Światło)

You create a dome of magical energy overhead, blocking incoming attacks. Anyone within the Area of Effect gains the Ward (6+) Creature Trait against magical or ranged attacks originating outside the dome. Those within may attack out of the dome as normal, and the dome does not impede movement.

 

Perhaps because they are magical, wear a special talisman, or are just plain lucky, some blows just seem to miss. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls Rating or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical. 

 

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Dome (Metal).name: Kopuła (metalowa)

Perhaps because they are magical, wear a special talisman, or are just plain lucky, some blows just seem to miss. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls Rating or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical. 

 

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Dome (Witchcraft).name: Kopuła (czary)
Dome (Witchcraft).description:
You create a dome of magical energy overhead, blocking incoming attacks. Anyone within the Area of Effect gains the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Bvd2aZ0gQUXHfCTh]{Ward (6+)} Creature Trait against magical or ranged attacks originating outside the dome. Those within may attack out of the dome as normal, and the dome does not impede movement.

 

Perhaps because they are magical, wear a special talisman, or are just plain lucky, some blows just seem to miss. Roll [[/r 1d10]] after any blow is received, if the creature rolls Rating or higher, the blow is ignored, even if it is a critical. 

 

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Doomed.name: Stracony
Doomed.description:
At the age of 10, a Priest of Morr called a Doomsayer took you aside to foretell your death in an incense-laden, coming-of-age ritual called the Dooming. In conjunction with your GM, come up with a suitable Dooming. Should your character die in a fashion that matches your Dooming, your next character gains a bonus of half the total XP your dead character accrued during play.

@Table[doom]

Dooming.name: Zagłada
Dooming.description: Gazing deeply into your target’s eyes while muttering a threnody to Morr, you are granted a vision of the target’s Doom, a glimpse of what the future holds. Tis is almost always related to the target’s death. This Miracle may only be performed on a character once, after which the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.fn8QNQQ1S2rh12Us]{Doomed} Talent may be purchased with XP as if it were in the target’s Career.

Doppelganger.name: Sobowtór
Doppelganger.description:
You weave a mask and cloak of Ulgu around your form, assuming the likeness of another humanoid creature with whom you are familiar (as determined by the GM). Your appearance will automatically fool anyone without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.OEjUvJKi0xmBwbS2]{Second Sight} Talent, though some may note if any of your mannerisms are incorrect. Those with that Talent must pass a Difficult (–10) Perception Test to notice you are disguising your form. This does not let them see through the spell. They must dispel it to do so.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Drain.name: Odpływ
Drain.description:
You touch your targets, draining their life. This counts as a Magic Missile with Damage +0 that ignores Armor Points. You then Heal 1 Wound.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Dramatic Injury.name: Dramatyczna kontuzja
Dramatic Injury.description: A fine wound across the forehead and cheek. Gain 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition. Once the wound is healed, the impressive scar it leaves provides a bonus of +1 SL to appropriate social Tests. You can only gain this benefit once.

Drilled.name: Wiercone
Drilled.description: You have been trained to fight shoulder-to-shoulder with other soldiers. If an enemy causes you to lose Advantage when standing beside an active ally with the Drilled Talent, you may keep 1 lost Advantage for each time you’ve taken the Drilled Talent.

Drop.name: Upuszczać
Drop.description: You channel magic into an object being held by an opponent. This could be a weapon, a rope, or someone’s hand. Unless a Challenging (+0) Dexterity Test is passed, the item is dropped. For every +2 SL you may impose an additional –10 on the Dexterity Test.

Drop (Beasts).name: Upuść (Bestie)
Drop (Beasts).description:
You channel magic into an object being held by an opponent. This could be a weapon, a rope, or someone’s hand. Unless a Challenging (+0) Dexterity Test is passed, the item is dropped. For every +2 SL you may impose an additional –10 on the Dexterity Test.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Drop (Daemonology).name: Upuść (Daemonologia)
Drop (Daemonology).description: You channel magic into an object being held by an opponent. This could be a weapon, a rope, or someone’s hand. Unless a Challenging (+0) Dexterity Test is passed, the item is dropped. For every +2 SL you may impose an additional –10 on the Dexterity Test.

Drop (Death).name: Upadek (Śmierć)
Drop (Death).description:
You channel magic into an object being held by an opponent. This could be a weapon, a rope, or someone’s hand. Unless a Challenging (+0) Dexterity Test is passed, the item is dropped. For every +2 SL you may impose an additional –10 on the Dexterity Test.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Drowned Man's Face.name: Twarz topielca
Drowned Man's Face.description: You implore Manann to drown your foes. Your targets’ lungs continuously fill with saltwater while the Miracle is active, and their hair ﬂoats around their head as if submerged. Your targets gains a @Condition[Fatigued] Condition, and are subject to the rules for @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#drowning-and-suffocation]{Drowning and Suffocation} while the Miracle is in effect. When the Miracle ends, your targets must attempt a Challenging (–20) Endurance Test. If a Failure is scored, also inﬂict a @Condition[Prone]{Prone} Condition.

Dual Wielder.name: Podwójny posiadacz
Dual Wielder.description: When armed with two weapons, you may attack with both for your Action. Roll to hit with the weapon held in your primary hand. If you hit, determine Damage as normal, but remember to keep your dice roll, as you will use it again. If the first strike hits, once it is resolved, the weapon in your secondary hand can then target an available opponent of your choice using the same dice roll for the first strike, but reversed. So, if you rolled 34 to hit with the first weapon, you use 43 to hit with the second. Remember to modify this second roll by your off-hand penalty (–20 unless you have the Ambidextrous Talent). This second attack is Opposed with a new defending roll, and damage for this second strike is calculated as normal. The only exception to this is if you roll a Critical for your first strike. If this happens, use the roll on the Critical Table to also act as the roll for the second attack. So, if you scored a critical to the head and rolled 56 on the Critical table for a Major Eye Wound, your second attack would then strike out with a to-hit value of 56. If you choose to attack with both weapons, all your defensive rolls until the start of your next Turn suffer a penalty of –10. You do not gain an Advantage when you successfully strike or Wound an opponent when Dual Wielding unless both attacks hit.

Dying Words.name: Umierające słowa
Dying Words.description:
Touching the body of a recently departed soul (one that passed away within the last day), you call its soul back brieﬂy. For the spell’s duration, you can communicate with the dead soul, though it cannot take any action other than talking. It is not compelled to answer you, but the dead do not lie.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Eagle's Eye.name: Oko Orła
Eagle's Eye.description: You call on Myrmidia to send a Divine Servant to grant you knowledge of your enemies. A spectral Eagle manifests, soaring into the sky above. The eagle looks like and has the capabilities of a normal eagle, but cannot physically affect the world, or be harmed in any way. While the Miracle is in effect, you can see through the eagle’s eyes and control its ﬂight, surveying the battlefield and spying upon your enemies. Your vision is acute, but you do not have access to any of your own sense-enhancing Talents such as Night Vision. While looking through the eagle’s eyes, you cannot see through your own eyes, leaving you potentially vulnerable.

Ear Bash.name: Uderzenie w ucho
Ear Bash.description: Your ear takes a sickening impact, leaving it ringing. Gain 1 @Condition[Deafened] Condition.

Earth Root.name: Korzeń Ziemi
Earth Root.description: This herb is ingested to negate the effects of Buboes caused by the Black Plague (though the swellings are still significant). Further, gain a bonus of +10 on all Tests concerning the disease. Dose: 1 per day.

Earthblood.name: Ziemska krew
Earthblood.description:
To cast this spell, you must be in direct contact with the earth. Standing barefoot counts. For the duration of the spell, any creatures in direct contact with the earth within AoE heal Wounds equal to your Willpower Bonus at the start of every Round.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Earthpool.name: Basen Ziemi
Earthpool.description:
On casting the spell, you immediately disappear into the ground in a wild torrent of Ghyran. You appear at the start of the next Round at any point within your Willpower in yards, erupting from the earth violently. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance travelled by your Willpower in yards. Any enemies engaged by you on your appearance gain the @Condition[Surpised] Condition. This spell will not allow you to move through stone but will allow you to move through water.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Eavesdrop.name: Podsłuchiwać
Eavesdrop.description:
You can hear what your targets say as if you were standing right next to them.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Elite.name: Elita
Elite.description: The creature is a hard-nosed veteran. It receives +20 to Weapon Skill, Ballistic Skill, and Willpower.

Embezzle.name: Zdefraudować
Embezzle.description: You are skilled at skimming money from your employers without being detected. Whenever you secure money when Earning (during play or performing an Income Endeavour), you may attempt an Opposed Intelligence Test with your employer (assuming you have one). If you win, you skim 2d10 + SL brass pennies, 1d10 + SL silver shillings, or 1 + SL gold crowns (depending upon the size of the business in question, as determined by the GM) without being detected. If your employer wins by 6+ SL, you gain the money, but your embezzling is detected; what then happens is left to the GM. Any other result means you have failed to embezzle any money.

Enchant Weapon.name: Zaczaruj Broń
Enchant Weapon.description:
You encase a single non-magical weapon with heavy bands of Chamon, enhancing its potency. For the duration of the spell it counts as magical, gains a bonus to Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, and gains the Unbreakable Quality. For every +3 SL you may also add 1 Quality or remove 1 Flaw from the weapon, while the spell is in effect.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Enclosed Fighter.name: Zamknięty myśliwiec
Enclosed Fighter.description: You have learned to make the most benefit out of fighting in enclosed spaces. You ignore penalties to Melee caused by confined spaces such as tunnels, the frontline, small fighting pits, and similar, and can use the Dodge Skill, even if it would normally be disallowed due to lack of space.

Engineering Marvel.name: Inżynieria Marvela
Engineering Marvel.description: Only for the exceedingly rich, you commission a work of art from one of the Engineers’ Guilds, allowing you to completely ignore the loss of an ear, hand, arm, or leg, as steam hisses and machinery clicks in place of blood and muscle. Should you ever receive a Critical Wound to the marvel, it automatically breaks down, and needs to be taken back for costly repair (at least 10% of the base cost, depending upon the nature of the Critical Wound received).

Entangle.name: Zaplątać
Entangle.description: Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Entangle (Beasts).name: Uwikłanie (Bestie)
Entangle (Beasts).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Entangle (Daemonology).name: Uwikłanie (Daemonologia)
Entangle (Daemonology).description: Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Entangle (Death).name: Uwikłanie (Śmierć)
Entangle (Death).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Entangle (Fire).name: Oplątanie (Ogień)
Entangle (Fire).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Entangle (Heavens).name: Uwikłanie (Niebiosa)
Entangle (Heavens).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Entangle (Hedgecraft).name: Oplątanie (żywopłoty)
Entangle (Hedgecraft).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Entangle (Life).name: Uwikłanie (Życie)
Entangle (Life).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Entangle (Light).name: Splątanie (Światło)
Entangle (Light).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Entangle (Metal).name: Splątanie (metalowe)
Entangle (Metal).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Entangle (Necromancy).name: Uwikłanie (Nekromancja)
Entangle (Necromancy).description: Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Entangle (Shadow).name: Uwikłanie (Cień)
Entangle (Shadow).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Entangle (Witchcraft).name: Uwikłanie (czary)
Entangle (Witchcraft).description:
Using magic, you entrap your target, wrapping them in whatever suits your Lore: vines, shadows, their own clothing… Your target gains one @Condition[Entangled] Condition with a Strength equal to your Intelligence. For every +2 SL, you may give the target +1 additional Entangled Condition. The spell lasts until all Entangled Conditions are removed.

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Ethereal.name: Eteryczny
Ethereal.description: The creature’s form is insubstantial, allowing it to pass through solid objects. It can only be harmed by Magical attacks.

Etiquette.name: Etykieta
Etiquette.description: You can blend in socially with the chosen group so long as you are dressed and acting appropriately. Example social groups for this Talent are: Criminals, Cultists, Guilders, Nobles, Scholars, Servants, and Soldiers. If you do not have the Talent, those with it will note your discomfort in the unfamiliar environment. This is primarily a matter for roleplaying, but may confer a bonus to Fellowship Tests at the GM’s discretion.

Extra Mouth.name: Dodatkowe usta
Extra Mouth.description: Roll on the @Table[hitloc]{Hit Location} table to see where.

Eye patch.name: Przepaska na oko
Eye patch.description: Often decorated, an eye patch is used to cover scarred eye sockets.

Fair Winds.name: Dobre Wiatry
Fair Winds.description: The target vessels’ sails fill with favorable winds, speeding them safely towards their destination. While this Miracle is active, the sailing vessel moves at top speed, no matter the prevailing wind, tide, or current, and all Tests made to steer the vessel gain a bonus of +10.

False Eye.name: Fałszywe oko
False Eye.description: Particularly popular amongst the rich who prefer not to wear cruder eye-patches, false eyes come in many forms, from wooden to polished glass.

False Leg.name: Fałszywa noga
False Leg.description: A False Leg (or just a False Foot, for half price), allows you to ignore 1 point of Movement loss due to the missing body part. Further, for 100 XP you can regain the last point of Movement Loss as you train yourself to use your new body part, and for 200 XP you relearn how to use Dodge again. This all requires you not to lose your False Leg, though.

Fast.name: Szybki
Fast.description: The creature moves unexpectedly fast. It receives +1 Movement and +10 Agility.

Fast Hands.name: Szybkie ręce
Fast Hands.description: You can move your hands with surprising dexterity. Bystanders get no passive Perception Tests to spot your use of the Sleight of Hand Skill, instead they only get to Oppose your Sleight of Hand Tests if they actively suspect and are looking for your movements. Further, attempts to use Melee (Brawling) to simply touch an opponent gain a bonus of +10 ' your level in Fast Hands.

Fast Shot.name: Szybki strzał
Fast Shot.description: If you have a loaded ranged weapon, you can fire it outside the normal Initiative Order before any other combatant reacts in the following Round. You roll to hit using all the normal modifiers. Employing Fast Shot requires both your Action and Move for your upcoming turn, and these will count as having been spent when your next turn arrives. If two or more characters use Fast Shot, the character who has taken this Talent most goes first. If any characters have taken Fast Shot an equal number of times, both shots are fired simultaneously, and should both be handled at the same time

Fat of the Land.name: Co najlepsze
Fat of the Land.description:
You ﬂood the target’s body with nourishing Ghyran. The target need not eat or drink, but will still excrete as normal, though any leavings will be verdant green.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Fate’s Fickle Fingers.name: Zmienne palce losu
Fate’s Fickle Fingers.description:
All allies within the Area of Effect, excluding those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, create a single pool for their Fortune Points. All may draw on the pool, first come, first served. When the spell ends, you reallocate any remaining Fortune Points as fairly as possible.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Faxtoryll.name: Faxtoryll
Faxtoryll.description: When smeared on a wound, poultices made from this herbal coagulant remove all Bleeding Conditions without a Heal Test. Dose: 1 per Critical Wound.

Fear.name: Strach
Fear.description:
The creature causes supernatural Fear in other creatures, with a rating equal to its Rating.

The Fear trait represents an extreme aversion to something. Creatures that cause Fear have a Fear Rating; this value reﬂects the SL you are required to pass on an Extended Cool Test to overcome your Fear. You may continue to Test at the end of every round until your SL equals or surpasses the creature’s Fear rating. Until you do this, you are subject to Fear.

When subject to Fear, you suffer –1 SL on all Tests to affect the source of your fear. You may not move closer to whatever is causing Fear without passing a Challenging (+0) Cool Test. If it comes closer to you, you must pass a Challenging (+0) Cool Test, or gain a @Condition[Broken] Condition.

Fear (Rating).name: Strach (ocena)
Fear (Rating).description:
The Fear trait represents an extreme aversion to something. Creatures that cause Fear have a Fear Rating; this value reﬂects the SL you are required to pass on an Extended Cool Test to overcome your Fear. You may continue to Test at the end of every round until your SL equals or surpasses the creature’s Fear rating. Until you do this, you are subject to Fear.

When subject to Fear,

  • You suffer –1 SL on all Tests to affect the source of your fear.
  • You may not move closer to whatever is causing Fear without passing a Challenging (+0) Cool Test. If it comes closer to you, you must pass a Challenging (+0) Cool Test, or gain a @Condition[Broken] Condition.

Fearless.name: Nieustraszony
Fearless.description: You are either brave enough or crazy enough that fear of certain enemies has become a distant memory. With a single Average (+20) Cool Test, you may ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from the specified enemy when encountered. Typical enemies include Beastmen, Greenskins, Outlaws, Vampires, Watchmen, and Witches.

Fearsome.name: Przerażający
Fearsome.description: Shrouding yourself in magic, you become fearsome and intimidating. Gain @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear 1}. For every +3 SL, you may increase your Fear value by one.

Fearsome (Beasts).name: Straszne (Bestie)
Fearsome (Beasts).description:
Shrouding yourself in magic, you become fearsome and intimidating. Gain @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear 1}. For every +3 SL, you may increase your Fear value by one.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Fearsome (Daemonology).description: Shrouding yourself in magic, you become fearsome and intimidating. Gain @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear 1}. For every +3 SL, you may increase your Fear value by one.
