Flock of Doom.name: Stado Zagłady
Flock of Doom.description:
You call down a murder of crows or similar local bird to assail your foes.

The ﬂock attacks everyone in the Area of Effect who does not possess the Arcane Magic (Beasts) Talent ferociously, inﬂicting a +7 Damage hit at the end of the Round. The ﬂock remains in play for the duration of the spell. For your Action you may make an Average (+20) Charm Animal Test to move the ﬂock to another target within range. While within the Area of Effect, all creatures gain +1 @Condition[Blinded] Condition.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Fool’s Gold.name: Złoto głupców
Fool’s Gold.description:
You weave Chamon into a non-magical object made of metal, fundamentally altering its alchemical nature. For the duration of the spell, all metal in the object becomes gold. This is not an illusion: it has actually transformed into gold. When the spell ends, the item reverts to its original metal. This spell can ruin good weapons, make armor too heavy to wear, and turn lead coins into something much more appealing. Spot effects arising from this spell are left in the hands of the GM.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Forest of Thorns.name: Las Cierniowy
Forest of Thorns.description:
This spell may only target a patch of earth (though the patch can be very small). You cause a dense knot of wickedly spiked brambles and tangled vines to burst upwards, covering the Area of Effect.

While the spell is active, anyone attempting to traverse the area on foot without the Arcane Magic (Life) Talent must make a Hard (–20) Agility Test. Failure means they gain 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition, and 1 @Condition[Entangled] Condition, with your Willpower used for its Strength. After the spell concludes, the growth remains, but loses its preternatural properties.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Forge of Chamon.name: Kuźnia Chamona
Forge of Chamon.description:
You alter the quality of a single item made of metal. You may add 1 Quality or remove 1 Flaw. For every +2 SL, you may add another Quality or remove another Flaw.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Fractured Hip.name: Złamane biodro
Fractured Hip.description: Gain a @Condition[Stunned] Condition. Take a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or also gain the @Condition[Prone] Condition. Suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.QluSTTTq3viHJJUh]{Broken Bone (Minor)} injury.

Fractured Jaw.name: Złamana szczęka
Fractured Jaw.description: With a sickening crunch, pain fills your face as the blow fractures your jaw. Gain 2 @Condition[Stunned] Conditions. Suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.nbhn2wX35b7Jrcbg]{Broken Bone (Minor)} injury.

Frenzy.name: Szał
Frenzy.description:
With a Willpower Test, you can work yourself into a state of frenzy by psyching yourself up, howling, biting your shield, or similar. If you succeed, you become subject to Frenzy.

While subject to Frenzy

  • You are immune to all other psychology, and will not ﬂee or retreat for any reason;
  • Indeed you must always move at full rate towards the closest enemy you can see in order to attack.
  • Generally, the only Action you may take is a Weapon Skill Test or an Athletics Test to reach an enemy more quickly.
  • Further, you may take a Free Action Melee Test each Round as you are throwing everything you have into your attacks.
  • Lastly, you gain a bonus of +1 Strength Bonus, such is your ferocity.

You remain in Frenzy until all enemies in your line of sight are pacified, or you receive the @Condition[Stunned] or @Condition[Unconscious] condition. After your Frenzy is over you immediately receive a @Condition[Fatigued] condition.

Frightening.name: Przerażający
Frightening.description: Anyone sane thinks twice before approaching you. If you wish, you have a Fear Rating of 1 . Add +1 to this number per extra time you have this Talent.

Furious Assault.name: Wściekły atak
Furious Assault.description: Your blows follow one another in quick succession, raining down on your opponents with the fury of Ulric. Once per Round, if you hit an opponent in close combat, you may immediately spend an Advantage or your Move to make an extra attack (assuming you have your Move remaining).

Fury.name: Furia
Fury.description: The creature can work itself into an all-consuming rage. It can spend all of its Advantage (minimum of 1) to become subject to Hatred to close combat opponents. If the creature has at least 3 Advantage, it may instead expend all of its Advantage to become subject to Frenzy.

Fury's Call.name: Zew Fury'ego
Fury's Call.description: Your passionate prayers instill your allies with a furious disdain for their foes. All allies affected receive the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.5hH73j2NgPdsLCZN]{Hatred} Psychology towards any engaging them in combat.

Galloping Trots.name: Galopujące kłusaki
Galloping Trots.description: It is said Halﬂing food won’t give you Galloping Trots, a messy affliction all too common in the Empire given just how little care is given to the proper preparation of food, but those suffering ‘Rumster’s Revenge’ from the cheap, Halﬂing pies on sale across Altdorf, would disagree, assuming they could escape the privy for long enough…

Gaping Arm Wound.name: Rozwarta rana ramienia
Gaping Arm Wound.description:
The blow opens a deep, gaping wound. Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Until you receive @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery} to stitch up the cut, any associated Arm Damage you receive will also inflict 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition as the wound reopens.

The Active Effect for this item needs your input. Replace ARM_LOCATION_HERE with lArm or rArm

Gaping Chest Wound.name: Rozwarta rana w klatce piersiowej
Gaping Chest Wound.description: Take 3 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Until you receive @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}, any Wounds you receive to the Body Hit Location will inflict an additional Bleeding Condition as the cut reopens.

Ghostly Howl.name: Upiorne Wycie
Ghostly Howl.description: The creature can emit a chilling howl, capable of killing those who hear it. On its turn the creature can spend all its Advantage (minimum of 2), to unleash a hideous scream as a Free Attack. All living targets within a number of yards equal to the creature’s Initiative immediately gain 3 Deafened Conditions and suffer 1d10 Wounds ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points. Those affected must also pass an Average (+20) Endurance test or gain a Broken Condition.

Gilded Nose.name: Złocony nos
Gilded Nose.description: Though most are made of wood or ceramic, the term gilded nose is widely used regardless. You can ignore the Fellowship loss for having no nose.

Glittering Robe.name: Błyszcząca szata
Glittering Robe.description:
Wild ﬂurries of Chamon whirl around you, deﬂecting blows and intercepting missiles and magical attacks. Gain @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Bvd2aZ0gQUXHfCTh]{Ward (9+)} against all attacks and spells targeting you. Each hit successfully saved increases the Ward’s effectiveness by 1, to a maximum of Ward (3+).

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Goodwill.name: Życzliwość
Goodwill.description:
You create an atmosphere conducive to friendliness and good spirits. All Fellowship Tests within the Area of Effect receive a bonus of +10, and Animosity and Hatred Psychologies have no effect.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Grappling Hook.name: Hak do chwytania
Grappling Hook.description: Coupled with a rope, allows unscalable surfaces to be climbed.

Great Fires of U’Zhul.name: Wielkie Ognie U'Zhulu
Great Fires of U’Zhul.description:
You hurl a great, explosive blast of Aqshy into an enemy, which erupts into a furious blaze, burning with the heat of a forge. This is a Magic Missile with Damage +10 that ignores Armor Points and inﬂicts +2 @Condition[Ablaze] Conditions and the @Condition[Prone] Condition on a target. Everyone within the Area of Effect of that target suffers a Damage +5 hit ignoring Armor Points, and must pass a Dodge Test or also gain +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition. The spell stops behaving like a magic missile as the fire continues to burn in the Area of Effect for the duration. Anyone within the Area of Effect at the start of a round suffers [[/r 1d10+6]] Damage, ignoring APs, and gains +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Gregarious.name: Towarzyski
Gregarious.description: You just like talking to other folk and it seems they like talking to you. You may reverse any failed Gossip Test if this allows the Test to succeed.

Guild License.name: Licencja Gildii
Guild License.description: Guild licenses are usually printed on single sheets of parchment, stamped with an official seal, and signed by the local guild master. Guild licenses are not purchased; instead, they are granted to guild members according to each guild’s traditions and laws.

Gunner.name: Artylerzysta
Gunner.description: You can reload blackpowder weapons with practiced ease. Add SL equal to your level in Gunner to any Extended Test to reload a Blackpowder weapon.

Gust.name: Poryw
Gust.description:
You create a brief gust of wind, strong enough to blow out a candle, cause an open door to slam, or blow a few pages to the ﬂoor.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Gut Blow.name: Uderzenie w jelita
Gut Blow.description: Gain 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition. Pass an Easy (+40) Endurance Test, or vomit, gaining the @Condition[Prone] Condition.

Hacked Leg.name: Zhakowana noga
Hacked Leg.description: A cut bites down into the hip. Gain 1 @Condition[Prone] and 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions, and suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.7mCcI3q7hgWcmbBU]{Broken Bone (Minor)} injury. Further, take a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or also gain a @Condition[Stunned] condition from the pain.

Hardy.name: Wytrzymały
Hardy.description: You gain a permanent addition to your Wounds, equal to your Toughness Bonus. If your Toughness Bonus should increase, then the number of Wounds Hardy provides also increases.

Hat.name: Kapelusz
Hat.description: Fine quality hats are status symbols in the Empire’s towns and cities. The more ﬂamboyant the hat, the better.

Hateful Impulses.name: Nienawistne impulsy
Hateful Impulses.description: Subject to Animosity to all not of your species

Hatred.name: Nienawiść
Hatred.description: You are consumed with Hatred for the Target, which is normally a group of people or creatures, such as ‘Hochlanders’, ‘Bog Octopuses’, or ‘Slavers’. You will never socially interact with someone or something you hate in this manner. On encountering the object of your Hatred, you must attempt a Psychology Test. If failed, you are subject to Hatred. At the end of every subsequent Round, you may attempt another Psychology Test to bring the Hatred to an end. If you do or not, the effects of Hatred naturally come to an end when all members of the specified group in your line of sight are dead or gone, or you gain the Unconscious condition. While subject to Hatred, you must immediately attempt to destroy the hated group by the fastest and most deadly means possible. You gain a bonus of +1 SL on all combat Tests against the specified group, and are immune to Fear and Intimidate (but not Terror) caused by your hated foe.

Hatred (Target).name: Nienawiść (Cel)
Hatred (Target).description:
You are consumed with Hatred for the Target, which is normally a group of people or creatures, such as ‘Hochlanders’, ‘Bog Octopuses’, or ‘Slavers’. You will never socially interact with someone or something you hate in this manner.

On encountering the object of your Hatred, you must attempt a Psychology Test.If failed, you are subject to Hatred. At the end of every subsequent Round, you may attempt another Psychology Test to bring the Hatred to an end. If you do or not, the effects of Hatred naturally come to an end when all members of the specified group in your line of sight are dead or gone, or you gain the @Condition[Unconscious] condition.

While subject to Hatred, you must immediately attempt to destroy the hated group by the fastest and most deadly means possible.

  • You gain a bonus of +1 SL on all combat Tests against the specified group.
  • You are immune to @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Ib2YQYChktDFN93y]{Fear} and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.I0yPc4PH5erWJLmu]{Intimidate} (but not @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.meMkLEwdJIDLxM0B]{Terror}) caused by your hated foe.

Haunting Horror.name: Nawiedzający horror
Haunting Horror.description:
You target a single location, such as a house or clearing, and inﬂict haunting dreams and waking nightmares on any who enter there. Those entering while the spell is in effect are unnerved by eerie sensations, ﬂitting shadows, and whispered voices lurking on the threshold of hearing. Unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Witchcraft) Talent, they gain +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition. Then, unless they pass an Average (+0) Cool Test, they gain another +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition and the @Condition[Broken] Condition, both of which are only removed upon leaving the location.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inﬂict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell’s CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Healing Draught.name: Uzdrawiający Wyciąg
Healing Draught.description: If you have more than 0 Wounds, recover Toughness Bonus Wounds immediately. Dose: 1 per encounter.

Healing Light.name: Uzdrawiające Światło
Healing Light.description:
Your target glows with a bright, cleansing light (equivalent light to a campfire), healing Intelligence Bonus + Willpower Bonus Wounds. If the Target passes a Very Hard (–20) Endurance Test, 1 Corruption point gained in the last hour is also lost.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Healing Poultice.name: Leczniczy okład
Healing Poultice.description: This foul-smelling medicinal wrap is made from animal dung and urine combined with any number of common herbs such as Sigmafoil, Tarrabeth, and Valerian. You do not suffer any Minor Infections from a Critical Wound treated with a Healing Poultice.

Heartkill.name: Zabójstwo serca
Heartkill.description: Combining the venoms from an Amphisbaena (a rare, two-headed serpent) and a Jabberslythe produces an odorless, colorless poison. When ingested, the deadly mixture inﬂicts 4 Poisoned Conditions. Resisted with a Difficult (–10) Endurance Test.

Heed Not the Witch.name: Nie słuchaj wiedźmy
Heed Not the Witch.description: You call on Sigmar to protect those close to you from the fell inﬂuence of Chaos. Any spells that target anyone or anywhere within Fellowship Bonus yards suffer a penalty of –20 to Language (Magick) Tests, in addition to any other penalties. For every +2 SL, you may increase the area of effect by your Fellowship Bonus in yards.

Hoarfrost's Chill.name: Chłód Szronu
Hoarfrost's Chill.description: You scream angry prayers, and cold Ulric answers. Your eyes gain a steely blue glint and the air around you grows unnaturally cold. You cause @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear 1} in all enemies, and all within your Fellowship yards range lose –1 Advantage at the start of each Round, as they are chilled to the bone.

Holy Hatred.name: Święta Nienawiść
Holy Hatred.description: Your prayers drip with the hatred you feel for your blasphemous enemies. You deal +1 Damage with Miracles for each level in this Talent.

Holy Visions.name: Święte wizje
Holy Visions.description: You clearly see the great works of the Gods all around you. You automatically know when you enter Holy Ground, and may take an Intuition Test to receive visions (often obscure, and seen through the paradigm of your cult or individual belief-system) regarding the local area if significant events have occurred there in the past.

Hook.name: Hak
Hook.description: You have a hook strapped where you used to have a hand. A surprisingly nimble tool once you are used to it, you can buy back the –20 penalty on all Tests involving two hands for 100 XP per 5 you subtract from the penalty, removing the penalty completely for 400 XP. Append: In Close Combat, a Hook counts as a Dagger

Horns (Feature).name: Rogi (funkcja)
Horns (Feature).description: The creature has horns or some other sharp appendage (if its Horns Trait represents a different feature it will be noted in brackets). When the creature gains an Advantage for Charging, it may make a Free Attack with its Horns, performed as normal, using Rating to calculate Damage (its Strength Bonus is already included).

Howl of the Wolf.name: Wycie Wilka
Howl of the Wolf.description: You howl for Ulric’s aid, and he sends a minor Divine Servant in the form of a White Wolf. The wolf fights your enemies for the duration of the Miracle, before vanishing to Ulric’s Hunting Grounds with a spectral, blood-chilling howl. The White Wolves have the statistics of a Wolf with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.yRhhOlt18COq4e1q]{Frenzy}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.mDgEMOoJpi8DkRYb]{Magical}, and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.8slW8CJ2oVTxeQ6q]{Size (Large)} Creature Traits.

Hungry.name: Głodny
Hungry.description: The creature is always hungry for fresh meat. If it kills or incapacitates a living opponent (or encounters a fresh body), it must pass a Average (+20) Willpower Test or feast, losing its next Action and Move.

Hunter's Eye.name: Oko myśliwego
Hunter's Eye.description: You are a skilled hunter and know all the best techniques to find game. When travelling through well-stocked lands, you are automatically assumed to be able to hunt down enough game to feed yourself and a number of others equal to your level in Hunter's Eye, so long as you have time and the correct equipment. You may secure more food in addition to this using the normal rules for foraging.

Hunter's Hide.name: Skóra myśliwego
Hunter's Hide.description:
You cloak yourself in a shimmering mantle of Ghur. While the spell lasts, gain a bonus of +20 Toughness and the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.JQa5DLnTs2SEzRrc]{Dark Vision} and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Traits, as well as the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9h82z72XGo9tfgQS]{Acute Sense} Talent.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Illusion.name: Iluzja
Illusion.description:
You spin a web of intricate strands of Ulgu, obfuscating the Area of Effect with an illusory image of your choosing. You will automatically fool anyone without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.OEjUvJKi0xmBwbS2]{Second Sight} Talent. Those with that Talent must pass a Difficult (–10) Perception Test to notice the illusion. This does not let them see through the spell. They must dispel it to do so. The illusion is, by default, static. For your Action, you may make a Hard (–20) Channeling Test to make the illusion move for that Round.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Immunity.name: Odporność
Immunity.description: The creature is completely immune to a certain type of Damage, such as poison, magic, or electricity. All Damage of that type, including from a Critical Wound, is ignored.

Immunity to Psychology.name: Odporność na psychologię
Immunity to Psychology.description: Whether brave, exceedingly stupid, or just caught up in the moment, the creature is utterly fearless. It ignores the Psychology rules.

Impassioned Zeal.name: Namiętna gorliwość
Impassioned Zeal.description: When you talk about your cause, case, or religion, your words fill with passion and fervent zeal. You may double your Fellowship for the purposes of determining the number of people inﬂuenced by your Public Speaking when talking about your cause.

Implacable.name: Nieubłagany
Implacable.description: It takes a lot to finish you off. You can ignore the Wound loss from a Bleeding Condition. Each level in this Talent lets you ignore the Wound loss from an extra Bleeding Condition

In-fighter.name: W myśliwcu
In-fighter.description: You are skilled at drawing in close to an opponent. You suffer no penalties for fighting against an opponent with a longer weapon than you. Further, if you use the optional rules for In-fighting, gain a bonus of +10 to hit your opponent.

Infected.name: Zainfekowany
Infected.description: The creature, or its weapon, carries a nasty infection. If it causes a living opponent to lose Wounds, it must pass an Easy (+40) Endurance Test or contract a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.kKccDTGzWzSXCBOb]{Festering Wound}

Infestation.name: Inwazja
Infestation.description: The creature’s hide is infested with biting ﬂeas or similar. All opponents suffer a penalty of –10 to hit it in melee combat as the parasites distract and overwhelm them

Inspiring.name: Inspirujące
Inspiring.description: Your rousing prayers inspire discipline and coordination within the ranks. Affected targets gain the +1 @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.J9MK0AIaTbvd5oF6]{Drilled} Talent.

Instinctive Diction.name: Dykcja instynktowna
Instinctive Diction.description: You instinctively understand the language of Magick, and are capable of articulating the most complex phrases rapidly without error. You do not suffer a Miscast if you roll a double on a successful Language (Magick) Test.

Instrument.name: Instrument
Instrument.description: Various instruments are included in this category. The standard price and encumbrance reﬂects medium-sized instruments (e.g. mandolin, coach horn, small drum). Small instruments are half the price and 0 Encumbrance points (e.g. ﬂute, recorder, tambourine). Larger instruments are double the price and 2 Encumbrance points (e.g. harp, lute, large drum).

Internal Bleeding.name: Krwotok wewnętrzny
Internal Bleeding.description: Gain a @Condition[Bleeding] Condition that can only be removed through @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}. Contract @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.M8XyRs9DN12XsFTQ]{Blood Rot}.

Invoke.name: Odwołać się
Invoke.description: You are blessed by one of the Gods and can empower one of your Cult’s Miracles. Further, you may purchase extra miracles for 100 XP per miracle you currently know. So, if you already know 3 miracles, your next miracle costs 300 XP to purchase. Full rules for learning new miracles are provided in @UUID[JournalEntry.NcH9OhleJFfaUdon]{Religion and Belief}. Under normal circumstances, you may not learn more than one Invoke (Divine Lore) Talent. Further, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.mdPGZsn2396dEpOf]{Petty Magic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.3O9clK7LGyuLTHPW]{Arcane Magic} Talents when you have the Invoke Talent. You can unlearn this Talent for 100 XP, but will lose all of your miracles if you do so, and will also garner the extreme disfavor of your God, with effects determined by your GM

Iron Jaw.name: Żelazna szczęka
Iron Jaw.description: You are made of sturdy stuff and can weather even the strongest blows. Whenever you gain one or more Stunned Conditions, you may make an immediate Challenging (+0) Endurance Test to not take one of them, with each SL removing an extra Stunned Condition.

Iron Will.name: Żelazna wola
Iron Will.description: You have an indomitable will of iron, and will never willingly bow down before another. Use of the Intimidate skill does not cause Fear in you, and will not stop you speaking out against the intimidating party.

Itching Pox.name: Swędząca ospa
Itching Pox.description: Annual outbreaks of Itching Pox afflict most towns and cities of the Empire. The disease, which causes body-wide itchy blisters, is relatively mild, and very rarely has lasting complications, so it concerns few outside worried parents or vain nobles. So common is it, that most temples of Shallya have vials of white paste on hand to relieve the itching of the afflicted.

Jarred Arm.name: Jared Ramię
Jarred Arm.description: Your arm is jarred in the attack. Drop whatever was held in that hand.

Jewellery.name: Biżuteria
Jewellery.description: Prices vary by craftsmanship, metal type, and gem value. As a general guideline, common rings without any gemstones cost 10 coins equal to their metal type (i.e. brass, silver or gold) whereas necklaces cost 20 coins of the same metal type

Jump Up.name: Podskoczyć
Jump Up.description: You are hard to keep down. You may perform a Challenging (+0) Athletics Test to immediately regain your feet whenever you gain a Prone Condition. This Athletics Test is often modified by the Strength behind the blow that knocks you down: for every +10 Strength the blow has over your Toughness, you suffer a penalty of –10 to the Athletics Test, and vice versa

King of the Wild.name: Król Dzikiego
King of the Wild.description: You chant a low prayer, and Taal answers with a wild animal appropriate for the surrounding area, which will act according to your wishes for the duration of the Miracle. See The Beasts of the Reikland for sample animals that may be summoned.

Kingpin.name: Kingpina
Kingpin.description: You have earned an air of respectability despite your nefarious ways. You may ignore the Status loss of the Criminal Talent.

Lamp Oil.name: Lampa olejna
Lamp Oil.description: Contains enough fuel for 4 hours of standard use, or 8 hours of low ﬂame equivalent to a candle.

Last Rites.name: Ostatnie namaszczenie
Last Rites.description: You chant a solemn requiem over a corpse. This miracle ensures that the soul is sent through the portal to Morr’s realm, and guarantees the cadaver may not be targeted by any Necromantic spells. If the Miracle targets a foe with the Undead and Construct Creature Traits, it will be destroyed.

Leader.name: Lider
Leader.description: The creature is a practiced leader. It receives a bonus of +10 to Fellowship and Willpower. Note: this Trait cannot be taken by creatures with the Bestial Trait.

Leaping Stag.name: Skaczący Jeleń
Leaping Stag.description: You chant to Father Taal, and he grants you his favor, imbuing you with speed and agility. You gain +1 Movement and +1 @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.CV9btQn09S9Fn8Jk]{Strong Legs} Talent. Further, you automatically pass all Athletics Tests to jump with at least +0 SL; should you score lower, increase the SL to 0.

Legal Document.name: Legalny dokument
Legal Document.description: A simple legal document such as a will, IOU or letter of intent.

Lie of the Land.name: Kłamstwo Ziemi
Lie of the Land.description:
Touching the earth, your senses ﬂow through the Ghyran tracing the nearby area. After communing for 1 minute, you receive a detailed mental map of all-natural features — land, forests, rivers, but not settlements — within range. Settlements may be alluded to — areas of clear terrain, or dug trenches, for example. Each time you increase the range with SL increases the time taken communing with the land by +1 minute.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Lifebloom.name: Rozkwit życia
Lifebloom.description:
You cause Ghyran to ﬂood an area that is blighted or desolate. You may target either a dry riverbed, well, field, or a domestic animal. If you successfully cast the spell, the target bursts to life:

  • A dry river begins to ﬂow once again
  • A dry or polluted well becomes clean and fresh
  • A planted field, vineyard or orchard bursts into life, with all crops immediately reaching full ripeness
  • A sick or unproductive animal becomes healthy. The affected beast is now healthily productive (cows produce milk, hens lay eggs, coats and hides of sheep and cows are healthy and lustrous) and any diseases are cured.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Light.name: Światło
Light.description:
You create a small light, roughly equivalent to a torch, which glows from your hand, staff or some other part of your person. While the spell is active, you may choose to increase the illumination to that of a lantern, or decrease it to that of a candle, if you pass an Average (+20) Channeling Test.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Lightning Reflexes.name: Błyskawiczne refleksy
Lightning Reflexes.description: You gain a permanent +5 bonus to your starting Agility Characteristic (this does not count towards your Advances).

Linguistics.name: Językoznawstwo
Linguistics.description: You have a natural affinity for languages. Given a month’s exposure to any Language, you count the associated Language Skill as a Basic Skill with a successful Intelligence Test (which can be attempted once per month). Note: Linguistics only works for languages used to frequently communicate with others, so does not work with Language (Magick).

Lip Reading.name: Czytanie z ust
Lip Reading.description: You can tell what people are saying by simply watching their lips; you do not need to hear what they are saying. If you have an unobstructed view of the speaker’s lower face, you can attempt a Perception Test to understand what they are saying.

Lock Picks.name: Wybór zamków
Lock Picks.description: An assortment of small, variously-shaped tools needed to use the Pick Lock Skill without penalty.

Lord of the Hunt.name: Pan Łowów
Lord of the Hunt.description: You call on Taal to guide you in the hunt for your quarry, which must be an animal you have seen, or an individual you know (as limited by the GM). While the Miracle is in effect, you cannot lose your quarry’s trail save by supernatural means. Should your quarry enter a settlement, the trail ends there. You also receive +10 bonus to all Tests regarding your quarry while under the inﬂuence of the Miracle.

Lost Footing.name: Straciłem grunt pod nogami
Lost Footing.description: In the scuffle you lose your footing. Pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain the @Condition[Prone] Condition.

Love.name: Miłość
Love.description:
Poets write endlessly of love, and every minstrel of the Reikland knows dozens of songs praising the power of love. If your character has the Love trait towards one or more individuals, this reflects a deep and enduring emotional connection. This may be the intense romantic love for a wife, husband, or lover, a strong familial love for a sibling, parent, or child, or an especially strong friendship. 

You must come to the aid of someone you love if they are threatened physically or socially. You are immune to Fear and Intimidation while defending your loved ones, and you gain a bonus +1 SL to all related Tests.

Example: Rilla is a riverwoman and travels the Reik with her close-knit family. She has Love (Son), Love (Brother) and Love (Parents). You mess with Rilla’s family, you mess with Rilla!

Luck.name: Szczęście
Luck.description: They say when you were born, Ranald smiled. Your maximum Fortune Points now equal your current Fate points plus the number of times you’ve taken Luck.

Mad Cap Mushrooms.name: Szalone Grzyby Cap
Mad Cap Mushrooms.description: These hallucinogenic mushrooms are eaten by Goblin fanatics before battle. They induce a berserker rage, adding +10 Strength, +4 Wounds, and the Frenzy Talent. When the effect wears off, the user loses 1d10 Wounds. Non-Greenskins must also pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or contract a Minor Infection. Duration: Active when chewed plus an additional 2d10 minutes.

Magic Flame.name: Magiczny Płomień
Magic Flame.description:
You kindle a small ﬂame that ﬂickers to life in the palm of your hand. It will not burn you, but will emit heat and set ﬂammable objects alight, like a natural ﬂame.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Magic Resistance.name: Odporność na magię
Magic Resistance.description: Magic has a reduced effect on the creature. The SL of any spell affecting it is reduced by the Rating given. So, Magic Resistance 2 would reduce the SL by 2.

Magic Shield.name: Magiczna Tarcza
Magic Shield.description: You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Magic Shield (Beasts).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Bestie)
Magic Shield (Beasts).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Magic Shield (Daemonology).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Daemonologia)
Magic Shield (Daemonology).description: You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Magic Shield (Death).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Śmierć)
Magic Shield (Death).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Magic Shield (Fire).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Ogień)
Magic Shield (Fire).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Magic Shield (Heavens).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Niebiosa)
Magic Shield (Heavens).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Magic Shield (Hedgecraft).name: Magiczna tarcza (żywopłot)
Magic Shield (Hedgecraft).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Magic Shield (Life).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Życie)
Magic Shield (Life).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Magic Shield (Light).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Światło)
Magic Shield (Light).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Magic Shield (Metal).name: Magiczna tarcza (metalowa)
Magic Shield (Metal).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Magic Shield (Necromancy).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Nekromancja)
Magic Shield (Necromancy).description: You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Magic Shield (Shadow).name: Magiczna Tarcza (Cień)
Magic Shield (Shadow).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Magic Shield (Witchcraft).name: Magiczna tarcza (czary)
Magic Shield (Witchcraft).description:
You encase yourself in bands of protective magic. While the spell is active, add +Willpower Bonus SL to any dispel attempts you make.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Tradycja: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Magical.name: Magiczny
Magical.description: The creature is wreathed in magic. All its attacks count as Magical, meaning it can harm creatures only susceptible to magical attacks.

Magical Sense.name: Zmysł magiczny
Magical Sense.description: You are able to sense the Winds of Magic in others. You may attempt an Average (+20) Intuition Test whenever you encounter a spellcaster. If you pass, you sense the target is a witch. Further, if you score an Astounding Success (+6), can also determine the target’s highest Channeling Specialization.

Magnum Opus.name: Wybitne dzieło
Magnum Opus.description: You are an undisputed master in your field, able to create work of such incredible complexity others can but sit back and marvel at your genius. Each time you take this Talent you may create a single, extraordinary work of art with one of your Art or Trade Skills. Tis work is unrivalled in your field, a unique piece that will always impress, giving bonuses as determined by the GM, most commonly to Fellowship Tests from those who have witnessed your astounding work. Selling the piece will net you at least ten times its normal value, and sometimes significantly more than this.

Major Chest Wound.name: Poważna rana klatki piersiowej
Major Chest Wound.description: You take a significant wound to your chest, flensing skin from muscle and sinew. Take 4 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Until you receive @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.WCivInLZrqEtZzF4#surgery]{Surgery}, to stitch the wound together, any Wounds you receive to the Body Hit Location will also inflict 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions as the tears reopen.

Major Ear Wound.name: Poważna rana ucha
Major Ear Wound.description: The blow damages your ear, leaving you with permanent hearing loss in one ear. Suffer a -20 penalty on all Tests relating to hearing. If you suffer this result again, your hearing is permanently lost as the second ear falls quiet. Only magic can heal this.

Major Eye Wound.name: Poważna rana oka
Major Eye Wound.description: The blow cracks across your eye socket. Gain 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition. Also gain 1 @Condition[Blinded] Condition that cannot be removed until you receive Medical Attention.

Manacles.name: Kajdany
Manacles.description: Prisoners trying to break out of manacles suffer 1 Wound and must pass a Very Hard (-30) Strength Test.

Manann's Bounty.name: Nagroda Mananna
Manann's Bounty.description: You implore Manann to provide you with sustenance. Reaching into a body of water you catch enough fish to feed 1 person; if you reach into the sea, you provide enough fish for 2 people. For every +2 SL, you may feed another person.

Mandrake Root.name: Korzeń mandragory
Mandrake Root.description: This highly-addictive deliriant grows under gallows, and is chewed to keep an unquiet mind still. Users must pass a Willpower Test every Round to perform an Action or a Move (choose one); further, Movement is halved. However, Cool Tests receive a bonus of +20. Duration: Active when chewed plus an additional 1d10×10 minutes.

Mangled Ear.name: Zniekształcone ucho
Mangled Ear.description: Little is left of your ear as the blow tears it apart. You gain 3 @Condition[Deafened] and 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions. Lose your ear — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.8piWcBKFlQ2J1E3A]{Amputatation (Average)}.

Mangled Hand.name: Zniekształcona dłoń
Mangled Hand.description: Your hand is left a mauled, bleeding mess. You lose your hand — @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.zyocWSzEZEC826NS]{{Amputation (Hard)}. Gain 2 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition. Take a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain the @Condition[Stunned] and @Condition[Prone] Conditions.

Mangled Jaw.name: Zniekształcona szczęka
Mangled Jaw.description: The blow almost removes your jaw as it utterly destroys your tongue, sending teeth flying in a shower of blood. Gain 4 @Condition[Bleeding] and 3 @Condition[Stunned] Conditions. Make a Very Hard (-30) Endurance Test or gain an @Condition[Unconscious] Condition. Suffer a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.hCadFsTRvLN9faaY]{Broken Bone (Major)} injury and lose your @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.rkJA1DlK51QuRlJy]{tongue} and [[/r 1d10]] @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.fBcZhOBn8IpoVqQ1]{teeth}— Amputation (Hard).

Manifest Lesser Daemon.name: Manifestujący się mniejszy demon
Manifest Lesser Daemon.description: You channel a sickening ﬂow of Dhar, brieﬂy forcing a rent into the fabric of reality. A Lesser Daemon immediately manifests through the rent. Perform an Opposed Channel (Dhar)/Willpower Test with the Daemon. If successful, the Daemon will respond to one command issued by you, quite literally, then vanish (assuming the command is completed before the Duration ends). If failed, the Daemon immediately attacks.

Marksman.name: Snajper
Marksman.description: You gain a permanent +5 bonus to your starting Ballistic Skill (this does not count towards your Advances).

Marsh Lights.name: Światła bagienne
Marsh Lights.description:
You create a number of ﬂickering magical lights up to your Intelligence Bonus. They resemble torches or hooded lanterns. Providing they remain within line of sight, for your Action you may control the lights by passing an Average (+20) Channeling Test; a success allows you to send the lights moving in any direction. They will move at walking pace in a straight line, passing through any objects (or witnesses) in their path, unless you test again to change their direction.

Lore: None

Tradycja: Żaden

Martyr.name: Męczennik
Martyr.description: You intone prayers concerning Shallya’s need to take on the world’s pain. Any Damage taken by your targets are instead suffered by you. If you suffer any Damage because of this Miracle, your Toughness Bonus is doubled for the purposes of calculating the Wounds suffered from that Damage.

Master of Disguise.name: Mistrz kamuflażu
Master of Disguise.description: You are an expert at taking on the appearance and mannerisms of others. With nothing but posture changes, face twisting, and careful use of appropriate clothing, you no longer look like yourself without having to use a Disguise Kit.

Master Orator.name: Mistrz mówca
Master Orator.description: You are skilled at firing up crowds. You gain a gain a SL bonus equal to your levels of Master Orator to any Charm Test when Public Speaking before a crowd.

Master Tradesman.name: Mistrz Handlowy
Master Tradesman.description: You are exceptionally skilled at your specified Trade skill. You reduce the required SL of any Extended Test using your Trade Skill by the level of your Master Tradesman Talent

Mauled Bicep.name: Zmiażdżony biceps
Mauled Bicep.description: The blow almost separates bicep and tendon from bone, leaving an ugly wound that sprays blood over you and your opponent. You automatically drop anything held in the associated hand and suffers a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.qn4ZpvTQIX4rcJDl]{Torn Muscle (Major)} injury and 2 @Condition[Bleeding] and 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition.

Menacing.name: Groźny
Menacing.description: You have an imposing presence. When using the Intimidate Skill, gain a SL bonus equal to your levels of Menacing.

Mental Corruption.name: Zepsucie psychiczne
Mental Corruption.description: The creature has Chaos on the mind. Roll on the @Table[mutatemental]{Mental Corruption Table}

Mimic.name: Imitować
Mimic.description: You have a good ear for accents and dialects, and can reproduce them accurately. You may replicate any accent you are exposed to for at least a day with an Initiative Test; this Test may be attempted once per day. Once passed, you may always mimic the accent, and locals will believe you to be one of their own

Mindslip.name: Przeskok umysłu
Mindslip.description:
You conjure delicate threads of Ulgu in your Target’s mind, causing all prior memory of you to disappear for the spell’s duration. Once the spell is over, the Target must pass an Average (+20) Intelligence Test, or the memory loss becomes permanent until dispelled.

Lore: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inﬂicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Tradycja: All spells cast from the Lore of Shadows inflicting Damage ignore all non-magical Armor Points.

Minor Arm Cut.name: Drobne rozcięcie ramienia
Minor Arm Cut.description: Gain a @Condition[Bleeding] Condition as your upper arm is cut badly.

Minor Head Cut.name: Drobne rozcięcie głowy
Minor Head Cut.description: The strike opens your cheek and blood flies everywhere. Gain 1 @Condition[Bleeding] Condition.

Minor Infection.name: Drobna infekcja
Minor Infection.description: Minor infections — slow-healing wounds with a modicum of swelling and heat — are extremely common. Most heal of their own accord in time, so few worry about them until it’s too late, and Morr’s Portal opens.

Miracles.name: Cuda
Miracles.description: The creature can enact Miracles; the relevant deity is indicated in brackets.

Mirkride.name: Mirkride
Mirkride.description:
Speaking ancient words of magic, your spirit leaves your body, stepping into the Hedge, the dark space between the material world and the spirit realm. For the duration, your stand apart from the world, able to witness it invisibly, but not affect it in any way. Physical barriers are no impediment to you, and you may walk through non-magical obstacles at will. Your body remains in place, immobile and insensate.

At the end of the spell you will be pulled suddenly back to your body. If your body is killed while you are walking the Hedge, your spirit will wander aimlessly for eternity.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Tradycja: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Moonflower.name: Kwiat księżycowy
Moonflower.description: This tranquilizer is a dried moss which grows only on leaves in the Laurelorn forest. Elves use Moonﬂower to treat Black Plague, granting a bonus of +30 to any associated Tests for Elves to resist the disease, otherwise it has no effect on their species. Others can inhale vapors from boiling the moss and if they fail a Very Hard (–30) Willpower Test will gain an Unconscious Condition; if passed, they receive a bonus of +20 to Cool Tests and gain a Fatigued Condition. Moonﬂower is used by the most expensive Physicians as an anesthetic. Duration: 1d10+5 hours.

Move Object.name: Przesuń obiekt
Move Object.description: Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Move Object (Beasts).name: Przesuń obiekt (Bestie)
Move Object (Beasts).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Tradycja: Whenever you successfully cast a spell from the Lore of Beasts, you may also gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear (1)} Creature Trait for the next [[/r 1d10]] Rounds.

Move Object (Daemonology).name: Przesuń obiekt (demonologia)
Move Object (Daemonology).description: Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Move Object (Death).name: Przesuń obiekt (śmierć)
Move Object (Death).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Tradycja: Targets afflicted by spells from the Lore of Death are drained of life, enervated, and listless. You may assign +1 @Condition[Fatigued] Condition to any living target affected by a spell from this lore. A target may only ever have a single Fatigued Condition gained in this manner at any one time.

Move Object (Fire).name: Przesuń obiekt (ogień)
Move Object (Fire).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Tradycja: You may inflict +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Fire, unless they also possess the Arcane Magic (Fire) Talent. Every Ablaze condition within Willpower Bonus yards adds +10 to attempts to Channel or Cast with Aqshy.

Move Object (Heavens).name: Przesuń obiekt (niebiosa)
Move Object (Heavens).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inﬂicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

Tradycja: Spells causing Damage ignore Armour Points from metal armour, and will arc to all other targets within 2 yards, except those with the Arcane Magic (Heavens) Talent, inflicting hits with a Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, handled like a magical missile.

For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Hedgecraft spells cannot be cast without ingredients, which are an integral part of their spellcasting process.

Fortunately, the ingredients they use are easily found on the fringes of settlements and are usually herbs or plants. You receive 1 + SL ingredients on a successful foraging roll, using Lore (Herbs), as described under Gathering Food and Herbs, or you can buy them for 5 brass pennies each.

Move Object (Life).name: Przesuń obiekt (życie)
Move Object (Life).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic ﬂoods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Move Object (Light).name: Przesuń obiekt (światło)
Move Object (Light).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Move Object (Metal).name: Przesuń obiekt (metal)
Move Object (Metal).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Move Object (Witchcraft).name: Przesuń obiekt (czary)
Move Object (Witchcraft).description:
Using magic, you grab hold of an non-sentient object no larger than you, moving it with the sheer force of your will, which is considered to have a Strength equal to your Willpower. You may move the object up to Willpower Bonus yards. If anyone attempts to impede the object’s movement, make a Contested Willpower/Strength Test. For every +2 SL you may increase the distance the object is moved by Willpower Bonus yards.

Lore: Each time practitioners of Witchcraft roll on a Miscast table, they also gain 1 Corruption point. Further, you may inflict one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on anyone targeted by spells from the Lore of Witchcraft. Lastly, channeling or casting spells from this Lore automatically require a roll on the @Table[minormis]{Minor Miscast table} unless cast with an ingredient, where the ingredient provides no further protection should you roll a Miscast. Fortunately, ingredients for the Lore of Witchcraft are cheap and readily available: body parts of small animals for the most part. Ingredients cost a spell's CN in brass pennies, instead of silver shillings, to purchase. Alternatively, a Witch may forage for parts, using the Outdoor Survival skill: a successful foraging roll receives 1 + SL ingredients, as described under Gathering Food and Herbs

Mundane Aura.name: Zwykła aura
Mundane Aura.description: You drain all the Winds of Magic from within your body and your possessions, removing any magical aura. For the duration of the spell you appear mundane to the Magical Sense Talent and similar. You effectively have no magical ability and your magical nature cannot be detected by any means. While this spell is in effect, you cannot cast any other spells. Mundane Aura is immediately dispelled if you make a Channeling Test.

Tradycja: Receive a +10 bonus to Casting and Channeling rolls when in a rural or wilderness environment. Living creatures — e.g. those without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits — targeted by Arcane Spells from the Lore of Life have all @Condition[Fatigued] and @Condition[Bleeding] Conditions removed after any other effects have been applied as life magic floods through them. Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Trait, on the other hand, suffer additional Damage equal to your Willpower Bonus, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points, if affected by any spell cast with the Lore of Life.

Mundane Aura (Light).name: Aura Światła (Światło)
Mundane Aura (Light).description:
You drain all the Winds of Magic from within your body and your possessions, removing any magical aura. For the duration of the spell you appear mundane to the Magical Sense Talent and similar. You effectively have no magical ability and your magical nature cannot be detected by any means. While this spell is in effect, you cannot cast any other spells. Mundane Aura is immediately dispelled if you make a Channeling Test.

Lore: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inﬂict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Tradycja: You may inflict one @Condition[Blinded] Condition on those targeted by Lore of Light spells, unless they possess the Arcane Magic (Light) Talent. If a target has the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.PFTD9gDvRWW9uh5g]{Undead} Creature Traits, spells also inflict an additional hit with Damage equal to your Intelligence Bonus that ignores Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.

Mundane Aura (Metal).name: Aura Przyziemnych (Metal)
Mundane Aura (Metal).description:
You drain all the Winds of Magic from within your body and your possessions, removing any magical aura. For the duration of the spell you appear mundane to the Magical Sense Talent and similar. You effectively have no magical ability and your magical nature cannot be detected by any means. While this spell is in effect, you cannot cast any other spells. Mundane Aura is immediately dispelled if you make a Channeling Test.

Lore: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck. So, if your spell hit an Arm location protected by 2 Armor Points of metal armor, it would cause an additional +2 Damage and ignore the Armor Points.

Tradycja: Spells inflicting Damage ignore Armor Points from metal armor, and inflict bonus Damage equal to the number of Armor Points of metal armor being worn on any Hit Location struck.
